text: Deep, sweet aroma of honey, liqueur, raspberry. Very intense, sweet flavor of honey mixed with some tart/acidic fruity touches, beyond that very mild wood, spice and alcohol. Super full, thick and sticky body. God damn is it tasty.

Sample from bottle. Clear amber colour, no head. Strong aroma of honey, raisins, berries, plums, some red fruits, light alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet, honey, raisins, dried fruits, plums, light toffee, ripe apples. Full body, syrupy, thick, sticky texture, flat carbonation. Warming and sweet fruity finish. Excellent mead, very complex and viscous.
Toffi, suszone owoce lekki alkohol. W smaku słodziutkie i jakby jabłko w toffi.

Sample from cgarvieuk dregs run. 
Appearance - amber red. Gloopy.
Nose - hint of red fruits but mostly intense honey.
Taste - intense red fruits and honey. Even some spice. 
Palate - big full body. Rich sweet and very long. 
Overall - very intense indeed.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours thick amber. Nose is supersweet, honey, faint raspberries, sherry. Taste is loads of honey, sherry-like sweetness, quite rich and has something going on - not only sweet. In its own unique style it is very nice. Treat it like dessert wine - meaning it goes extremely well with blue cheese!
Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep golden amber, nose is spiced, honey, caramel, raisin, date, taste is sickly sweet, Beeswax, thick, chewy, little sherry like, wood.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear red with no head. Aromas of light fruit, wood, honey. Taste is more like a dessert wine than a mead. Lots of depth. Good gear.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Sample thanks to linus! Poured a honey amber colour, sticky with alcohol legs on the Side of the glass. Nose of big sweet raisins, toffee, dark sweet fruits, sweet ripe raspberries, honey sweetness, caramel. Light sour raspberry. Sticky mouthfeel.

Pours deep amber and crystal clear with no head. Clings very nicely to the glass. Aroma is initially very much like a nice vintage port with rasins and dried figs. Theres also a hint of oaky vanilla in the aroma. Taste is deep dark honey with sassafrass and mellowed dark fruits. Wow this is nice. You can taste the age. Son, this is Churchillian in every way. My FIRST perfect score!

Chestnut colour with no head. Intense vineous sherry-like aroma with dried fruit, walnuts, wood, oxidation and honey. Sweet and intense flavour of fruit and nuts, like a thick, sweet dessert sherry, but with obvious overtones of honey. Outstanding

Piękna, bursztynowa barwa, oczywiście bez piany, na ścianach pojawiają się "łzy". Aromat może nie powala, jest wyczuwalna nuta alkoholowa, ale bardziej kojarzy się z brandy niż spirytusem. Za to w smaku jest po prostu bajka, spora słodycz, ale nie zamula, świetnie przełamana owocowym finishem. Alkohol w smaku kompletnie nie przeszkadza, ba, miód ten jest bardzo zdradliwy. No i tego ta gęstość... Coś pięknego.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer
Nie znam się na miodach, ale postaram się coś napisać. Dużo w tym kwiatów, odrobinę nawet chyba malin, dużo też alkoholu. Jest słodycz, gęstość i płaczące szkło. Szanuję.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Półtorak Jadwiga by Spółdzielnia Pszczelarska Apis at Pod MosteczkiemAle to slodko lepkie owocowe :) ma swoj urok choc w nosie spirytOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

250ml bottle. Dark copper shade. No head. Fruity and floral aroma. Chewy taste, toffee, anise, red fruits, orange peel. Sweet and rich but still well balanced. Was very disappointed when this was all gone.
Very, very sweet taste of fresh honey. Mostly floral aroma. Fruity sweet afteraste.

Bardzo dobry miód. Mega słodki, miodowo-owocowo, delikatnie kwaskowate owoce, całkiem gęste. Sporo karmelu, toffi, suszonych ciemnych owoców. Trochę przypomina Barley Wine z Baladina. Alkohol ukryty naprawdę przyzwoicie. No i szkło pięknie po nim płacze, jak po dobrej whisky. Świetne.

Piany oczywiście brak. Barwa rubinowo ruda, klarowna. W aromacie głównie suszone owoce, dojrzałe, słodkie maliny, słodkie czerwone wino typu porto, a w drugim planie wyraźny miód, odrobina ziół. W smaku słodkie, likierowe, owocowo miodowe, lekkie kwaskowe nutki malin i dzikiej róży w posmakach. Mocne rozgrzewanie od alkoholu, ale bardzo szlachetne, miłe. Fajna oleista, gładka i lepka konsystencja.

Trunek do powolnego smakowania przy kominku w małych ilościach... Po wypiciu nieco większej ilości robi się przeraźliwie słodki i zbyt agresywnie alkoholowy.

From bottle, bought in Poland at the airport. Aroma had definitely honey, but also plum (reminds of Chinese plum wine). Body is thick, since its 16 degrees. Taste is strongly sweet and honey again. I really like this.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours still deep amber. Rich and sweet. Starts with honey, then dark dried fruits, sherry, light candied fruit. Has a light acidic touch after the initial sweetness. Notes of tobacco, syrup and vanilla too. Warming alcohol. Good.

Bottle shared at THT. Clear amber brown with no head. 
Aroma of big floral honey, treacle and brown sugar. Flavour is very heavy sugary sweet. Above medium bodied with flat carbonation. Way too sugary sweet. [26-08-2016]

[Butelka]
Wygląd: Miodowe, lekko zamglone.
Aromat: Owoce, miód i alkohol.
Smak: Słodkość, alkohol, lekko piecze w przełyk.
Podsumowanie: To jest to, czego szukam w miodzie - słodycz, średnie ciało, przyjemny aromat.

Clear ruby color without foam. Sugar and honey in the nose with some alcohol. The taste is best described as thick, honey, thick, sweet, thick, quite alcoholic, thick and viscous. The aftertaste is sweet alcoholic sugary and the whole beverage is a bit too much.

Bottle. Put forest honey. Throughout. Aroma, taste, palate. Honey, honey, honey. Boozy and sweet and heavy and intense, but who cares, because: This shit? It works. Period. (Forest and pine needle and resin aroma too, but it doesnt really matter, believe me.)

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 Bottle. Slightly cloudy dark reddish color with no head. Aroma is intense flowery honey, sweet fruit liqueur, booze. Taste is sweet honey, flowery, one of the most sweet drinks I?ve ever had, but it?s so luscious. No carbonation, very viscous mouthfeel. A beauty.

Sampled at THT August. Clear reddish amber. Big sweet honey, bit metallic, but damn this sweetness. Biggest sweetest I might have ever tasted. Rooibos. Light bitter. Full body, big sugary body. Mega sweet but lovely vanilla soft finish.
Bottle at THT. Clear amber with no head. Massive horse sweat, honey, brandy, soap, lots of oxidized notes. Very very sweet with weird horse bitterness. Full bodied and no carbonation.

Bottle at the August THT, Den Haag. Poured a clear medium brown with no life. The aroma is super sweet malt, alcohol. The flavour is strong sweet with a rich sweet oily fruity alcohol palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation.
Bottle shared at August THT. Clear ruby with no head. Extremely sweet, brandy, honey, port. Full bodied, very smooth mouthfeel and a super sweet finish.

75cl bottle shared at August THT.
No head or carbonation. Slightly hazy amber pour. Very sweet. Honey aftertaste
Bottle at THT tasting. Aroma is very floral, honey and slightly spicy. Flavor is pure liquid honey, very sweet and thick. Heavy.

From bottle at Nightfalls place to end a great weekend. Thank you very much Alex!! clear amber copper ruby color with no head. Aroma is alcoholic and a bit oxidized, wood, cherry, berries, honey. Heavy sweet fruity taste like aroma with more honey. Medium oily body with flat carbonation.

Aroma: sweet, molasses, dried fruit, raisins, honey, noble alcohol note
Appearance: beautiful clear ruby
Taste: extremely sweet, cloying, dried fruit, alcohol, tobacco overtones
Palate: very full body, super sweet and alcoholic
Overall: a legend, good, but too sweet for my taste

750ml peruspullo, joskin myös maisteltu punottu erikoispullo ja 250ml minipullo. Jumalaisen hyvää tavaraa aina. Hapoton, hyvin rikkaan tummanpunaisen ruskea väri. Tuoksussa rusinaa, kukkaa. Suutuntuma ensin alkoholisen hyökkäävä, mutta heti pehmenee suussasulavaksi makeudeksi, jopa lievää vetisyyttä hetkittäin yläpäässä. Lämmin jälkipolte ja koko suun valtaava pyöreä makeus. Makeuden lisäksi ei juuri muita ominaisuuksia havaittavissa, jonka vuoksi pisteetkin noin alhaiset.
Pours clear dark amber.. Aroma; Rasberry, honey, burned sugar, some rose hips and floral. Taste; Sweet, honey, brown sugar, rasberries, rose hips woth a floral rosey touch.

Still mahogany / crimson body. Aromas of honey - raspberry character is a bit overshadowed by sweet honey character. The berry character does reveal itself more in the flavor. However, this is definitely a honey forward beverage. Sweet and viscous. A delightful drink to sip and savor.
Clear orange colour, sweet and fruity nose. Red berries, honey, flowers. Very well balanced. Lovely mead.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Bottle. Dark brown in colour. Lots of burned sugar, molasses and honey notes. In taste honey, butterscotch, apples and burned sugar. Texture is oily, syrupy, alcohol is there but is pleasant. Very good.

Unglaublich weicher Antrunk von nicht zu süßem Honig. Hintergründige aber klar erkennbar himbeereige Noten, Vollmundig nach Honig, überhaupt nicht alkoholisch. Langer warmer und süßlicher Nachhall. 5/13/13/15/9/14
75cl, butelka. Aromaty miodowe, alkohol i trochę malina. W smaku lepkie, miodowe, słodkie, lekko alkoholowe. Dosłownie ulepek.

Bottle share by Willrunforbeer. Thank on this one. Darker brown color. Aroma has a brown sugar, molasses and oak nuances. Not sure why I smell oak because this wasn t placed in a barrel. 

The flavor is really smooth and decadent. Layers of honey, butterscotch, brown sugar and apples. The booze is totally hidden with a syrupy, slick smooth texture. Light warming sensation after the sip. Very rich.

750ML Corked bottle, ceramic bottle. Thanks Brian for sharing. 

A - This mead is very dark black, orange, burnt color

S - The aroma is straight up honey, a lot of burnt aroma but with some tree fruit, baked apples and oranges.

T - Taste is apple, brandy, baked apples, a ton of fruit in this one. This is really really awesome

M - Dense, thick, oily and sweet. Lingering burnt brown sugar

O - This is insanely good!
Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours amber brown with nice lacing in the glass. Aromas of honey fruity and sherry. Taste is sweet dark fruit and honey with a nice boozy finish.
Pours an amber brown. Minuscule white head. Smells like honey. Flavor is wow. Taste is so sweet. Pure honey really. Thats amazing. This is the more pleasantly super sweet drink Ive ever consumed.
Extremely rich and refined, honey, notes of sherry and fruit, ABV evident. Very sweet, fullbodied and complex.
@Olut Expo 2015amber clear. Sweet deep honey, old apples, slight woody nose. Full sweet, soft with a clean intensive finish. Floral, strong meadowy, smooth.-- bb

Sample.
Pours very deep copper/light brown. Nice legs. Aroma is of alcohol, honey, flowers, sweet bread, sugar, porto. Taste is of alcohol, sugar, molasses, caramel, fruits, honey, porto. Palate: Burning alcohol, very full bodied. No carbonation. Overall: Very heavy on alcohol and sugar. Cloying to say the least. Complex for sure, yet this one is too much for me. Still more than decent.

4 oz sample. Deep brown pour, almost Clear. Aroma is really sugary tons of brown sugar, vanilla, rhum, port like winey notes, light cinnamon. Taste is very sweet, decadent boozy sweet port like flavors. Palate is strangely light bodied for the intensity of the sweetness, slightly watery finish. Good, but not as good as I expected.

(bottle, many thanks to the mead-mule for this one!) clear amber-ruby colour with no head. aroma of dark wild honey and lots of honeycomb wax, with a very faint touch of raspberries and earth. flavour is more honey and beeswax, appropriately sweet though never cloying, with a heavy earthiness, lots of moist wood, some bread dough and a slightly minerally warming finish. full-bodied and viscous with no carbonation.

Bottle. Pours an amazing clear amber, sticky and crazy lacing. Aroma is sweet, honey, heather, nutty, somme booze and light fruitiness. Taste has more spice and is kind of flowery. Slight grapefruit zest. Really nutty, walnut, prunes, toffee and liquor port-like booze. Slight slight tartness. Warming light dry finish, sticky and sugary, caramel.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak the great. Pours a pretty dark, reddish amber. Aroma has booze, honey, slight peppery spice, walnut, lots of nutty notes, slight port wine. Taste has much more prunes, but still nutty, caramel, raisins. Oily body with a dry walnutty finish.

pours oily burnt orange, amber tint, with some very sticky legs. strong and fragrant buckwheat honey, astringent wood - sandalwood, raspberry jam - hint acidity, spices-plenty, (subtle) raspberry-infused chocolate, astringent under-ripened red berry skin, cloying sweetness - honey concentrate if at all possible. flat carbonation, full body - cannot get any thicker, really; cloying, assertively astringent and fruity-spicy finish. very complex sipper - insanely sweet.
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 Smells like bourbon, barleywine, alcohol, and buckwheat honey. Taste is deep dark honey and pecans. Medium to thick body with some alcohol burn.

How: A few 1 oz samples at home over the last few weeks. Thanks to hackobock for the bottle! 

>>> A monster sipper mead with an insane amount of honey sweetness and a nice touch of raspberries to make it more palateable. 

-  Clear dark amber and it leaves long sticky legs on the glass (+) 
-  Theres an impressive amount of rich honey in the nose (+), but the alcohol is also quite present so its a bit boozy (-) 
-  The sweetness from honey is huge and success to hide the alcohol (+) 
-  Raspberries presence in both aroma is subtle (especially when compared to Schramms), but add a nice fruity and acidic (mild) dimension to the mead (+) 
-  The body is really thick and the sweetness is mouth coating and lingers a long time before being partially cut by a mild acidic presence (+) 
-  This is meant to be drink 1 oz at a time

Flavors:  Honey (massive!), alcohol, raspberries, mild spiciness, herbal notes

2 oz sample. Pours a deep, clear copper with some really nice legs. Nose is of rich honey and moderate alcohol. Taste is really sweet but not in a cloying manner, not at first at least. Flavors of honey, maple syrup, brown sugar. Some warming alcohol. Treacle. A very light fruitiness. Body is full and mouthfeel thick, sticky and syrupy. OK, a few (4-5) sips in it starts to get really cloying. I wouldnt drink more than an ounce in one sitting. Overall an interesting drink but maybe Im more a Trojniak kind of guy. Still a very nice experience, though.

Liquide à la robe ambrée avec des jambes qui senroulent autour de mon cou. Un nez complexe. Fleurs, miel foncé, sucre cuit, fruits liquoreux, raisins dorés, épices, bois oriental, parfum de femme. Un goût tellement doux mais tellement fonctionnel. Sucre dérable et sauce au miel, fleurs dalcool, fruits. Une bouche sirupeuse et collante. Une finale très douce qui devient rapidement chaude. Tout un dessert. À boire à petite dose. Excellent.

Deep copper color mead with strong honey and light woody notes. Taste is quite sweet with intense flora notes and with some brown sugar notes. Very intense, rich and complex. Light warming alcohol notes are also detectable. Not sure I would drink regularly but nice night cap.
Taster thanks to Bursprak. Pours cloudy dark sticky brown. Aromas of honey, raspberries, nutty notes, floral. Taste is sweet, sticky honey, nutty notes, brown sugar, caramel, floral, raspberries.

2 oz sample sent to me by Tom10101, thanks man! Appearance is reddish/brown. Aroma is light raspberry, honey, Apple, somewhat perfume like with some floral undertones. Taste is thick sweet honey, brown sugar, faint hints of fruit, and a touch of alcohol burn in the finish. Man, this is unlike any other mead Ive tried, very thick mouthfeel and exceptionally sweet but manages to avoid going over the top. Very smooth and alcohol is well hidden, great in small samples, awesome stuff!
Bottle, sample @ RBScSG 15. Flat bronze pour. Nose is sweet, honey, raspberries and some floral notes. Taste is smooth, sweet, honey, raspberry, floral notes and a slight burn. Slow sipper!
UPDATED: JUL 12, 2015 Sample at RBScSG. Clear cognac Amber no head. Vinous sweet alcohol. Sweet no carbonation low bitterness. A lot of honey.

Bottle @ Craft Clerko. Thanks to Mr Smith for supplying this longtime want! Amber pour with a small ring of bubbles. Nose is very strong and sweet. Straight concentrated honey. Nutmeg and cinnamon spices. General boozy heat. The flavor is very, very sweet and not as nuanced as I had hoped. Loads of honey, caramel. Little else. A touch of earthy wax. Cloying. Decent stuff, but I was a bit let down by this considering its lofty reputation.

750ml bottle. Pours a clear brown-red color. Aroma is hot, vinous, port honey. Flavor is honey forward, raisins, lacking any distinct raspberry tartness or flavor. Very smooth, extremely sweet, slightly oxidized. Overall good mead, not very balanced, but the sweetness is pleasant. Opens up nicely.

Bottle. Aroma is so intense and rich. Musty, earthy honey, flowers, light raspberry, maple, and oak. Tastes intensely sweet but also a bit of booze. All the aromas are there with some syrupy butterscotch too. Full body, syrupy mouthfeel. Very good but also hard to drink more than a few ounces.

Bottle: Thanks Geophagus: Wineglass:
Clear amber colored body with no head.
Aroma honey, wood, prunes, some apples, some sweets/light hint of sugars, some cabbage, toast, nutty and some cough syrup.
Flavour of spice, honey, wood, toast, sweets/sugars, light herbal, caramel, sticky, marzipan, some fruit (apple, prunes) and corn with an alcohol/spice thickness...

Na, das war doch mal was interessantes. Angenehm in der Säure mit einer wunderbaren Fruchtigkeit, hier angelehnt an Kirsche und Zitrone. Dahinter ein feiner Schuss Honig. So süffig und vollmundig - Klasse.

Bottle from Robert - many thanks! The mead has got a deep dark red-brownish colour with a smooth body. Aroma of intense honey and flowers. Taste of intense honey, ripe fruits, berries and flowers. Perfum and herbal hints. Wonderful and smooth to drink, very warming. Loved it.

text: This an absolutely beautiful reddish brown color. And it only gets better from there. A wonderful honey flavor but without being sweet really at all. Smooth and delicious, a friends mother brought this from Poland. Had with her home-cooked Polish dinner. Fantastic. Im really debating giving this a perfect score.

Body is medium to full, smooth, rich, no carbonation. Taste is sweet honey, tangy, a little salty seaweed, card, maybe clove? Nice.

Bottle shared at Leightons pad. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. Nice reddy amber orange coloured pour, nice and viscous. Aroma is earthy honey, hawthorn, plenty of hot alcohol, little orange. Flavour is really smooth pure honey, earthy nutty, sherry fruits, super drinkable. Palate is velvety, full bodied, sweet bodied. Very smooth, Warming alcohol in the finish. Packs a punch.
UPDATED: FEB 11, 2015 Aroma: honey, raspberry, alcoholTaste: sweet, raspberry, honey, fruity Fantastic mead!

Bottle at home in London - but just a little bit! Picked up at Julios. Pours clear, rich amber with no head. The nose holds a lot of rich honey, lightly crystallised, with subtle citric tones underscored flowers and dried berries. Warming on the finish with more rich, decadent and lightly toasted honey, some mellow alcohol, berries, clover. As you swirl it around your mouth it feels more and more like real honey. This is my 1000th rating. I chose to rate this particular mead for a reason ; I come from Poland and this seams to be the best Polish delicacy on RB. 
The bottle 50cl made of ceramic. 
It has a deep red color. It leaves clear stains on the glass.
NOSE : from far this mead has a wood like smell with strong aromas of fruits. Obviously the honey is on top layer. The fruit aromas are quite complex. Mostly red berry fruits. The aromas of booze comes up when putting the nose into the sniffer. After a while of oxidation it wares off. The quality of the honey aromas is just amazing. It has also notes of toffee and burned caramel. Even some chocolate. Roses. 
SIP : it is oily and sticky. It is quite thick. The feeling is very intense. The sweetness literally invades my mouth. Its quite a shock whenever it touches my taste buds. Behind the top layer of sweetness it gets a bit acidic. It reveals complex fruit and flower notes. Aftertaste is sweet with aromas of rose dominating the palate. 
OVERALL : its really a delicacy. Maybe not something one might choose to get drunk but something definitely to cheer up with.

25cl bottle while watching Derby Della Madonnina. Clear amber body. Aroma is sweet honey, caramel, light caramel. Flavour is sweet honey, maple syrup, light alcohol, sugary notes. This is really delicious. Wow I wish it was a 75cl bottle instead!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

honey, fruity aroma, some alcohol; amber clear; high sweetness, lightly bitter; thick, sticky, little oily, warming sweet finish; 
Overall: warming and sweet, very pleasant
750 ml bottle. Clear amber with no head. Aroma very vinous, port, flowers, rose, alcohol and honey. Thaste is sweet, honey, perfume, sugar and flowers. Very pleasant

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 20.03.2013, bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Sødmerik lett tørr lukt med preg av honning, tre, rosiner, sukker. Sødmerik konsentrert smak med preg av fyldig honning, sukker, karamell, tre, litt sure epler. God, men kanskje litt søt.

Bottled. Pours clear reddish amber in color. Sweetish cantaloupe and darker honey sweetness in aroma. Taste on the whole lot is just more sweeter and so smooth. A bit strong at time to time, but yet so smooth, nice honey, dark sweetness too in aftertaste. As an aperitif this is just outstanding.

Har länge gått och tänkt på den här när jag ser att den dyker upp på SBWF 2013. Äntligen! Ber naturligtvis om ett smakprov. Doften är otippat knuten. Inte mycket spännande där alls. Och det är nog på grund av detta som jag blir helt chockad. När jag tar förska klunken blir det som att gå en boxningsmatch mot Mike Tyson helt oförberedd. Pang! En total explosion av smaker bombarderar gommen och jag stapplar några sten bakåt. Underbar ljuv sötma men smaker av honung, nektar och Sauternesvin. En sån här flaska lär ju räcka ett tag. Lagom att dela på hundra pers typ. Eftersmaken är enormt lång och den skulle lätt kunna stå på egna ben som en efterrätt ensam. Men i en snygg kombination kan det säkert vara helt magiskt.

thnx to mikkeller crew @ bbf 13
pours amber, smell is pretty boozy . very sweet, very full and boozy . very much oak . nice !

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 (bottle - cellared for 10 years ) clear orange amber colour; aroma of honey, alcohol; thick palate; rich flavour, surprisingly vigorous acidity balances the sweetness, long medium sweet finish; very nice

Bottle. Pours a clear, slightly copper-ish brown. Has a substantial aroma sweet, sweet honey, ripe berries, and alcohol. Flavor is first and foremost sweet, and it comes close to obscuring any other flavor in it. In the background is super-sweet, ripe fruit, perhaps its raspberry, but it has so much trouble competing with the honey I find it it hard to tell. Through the entire experience is a very noticeable alcohol burn, but for me it doesnt detract. Interesting to try, but only something to sip in very small quantities.

750mL bottle, sent from pantanap (thanks a lot, Kan), pours a dark ruby red with no head. Aroma brings out loads of honey and raspberries, with liqueur and booze. Flavour is crazy decadent, with a ridiculous amount of honey absolutely dominating everything, followed by raspberries, and moderate alcohol but well-hidden. Insanely sweet, well beyond cloying level, though it is still decadent as hell. The booze is well-hidden, as the sweetness overtakes everything. Syrupy viscosity, not that far off from maple syrup or something similar. Too sweet for me, but I recognize the quality of this. Drinkable in extremely small quantities.

Beautiful thick dark amber that leaves legs all over the glass. Aromas of honey, rose, raisin and raspberry. Tastes like it smells, with a deep delicious sweet raisin flavor, like you would get in a world class ice wine. Just enough cirtic acidity to keep it from being cloying. Alcohol is well hidden. This is the best commercial sweet mead I have tasted.

Bottle shared at a Bruery event in 2011. Thick gold pour with not a lick of head. Nose is honey, vanilla, and orange blossoms. Taste follows the nose with a bit of vanilla. Super thick mouthfeel. This stuff tastes amazing but smart to enjoy at the end of a session. Too sweet to follow with anything else. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Deep amber mead with no head. Honey, sweet aroma. Very sweet and nice honey flavour.

Bottle courtesy of Kaj (non-RB). Pours clear goldenish red with no head worth mentioning. Smell is very sweet and slightly fruity with tons of honey, raspberries, rose hips, hay, dry wood, alcohol, raspberry hard candy, vanilla caramel candy, lemon zest, raisins and hints of dried flowers. Taste is extremely overwhelmingly sweet with craploads of honey, raspberries, dried rose hips, hay, dry wood, alcohol, raisins, dates and assorted vanilla and red fruit based candies. Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, silky, oily, very tiny fruity tart and full bodied. Finish is sweet sweet sweet with raspberries, dried rosehips, dry wood, raisins and tons of high quality honey. Intensely sweet, deceiving and extremely tasty.
Bottle tnx to Kaj. Pours beautiful clear amber redish. Aroma is fullbodied sweet raisins rosenips raspberry fruity honey. Flavor is as aroma, smooth sweet and so good.

800th RATING! This is also my first real mead rating. I thought I would start with one of the worlds best meads. Actually, it was the #1 mead on RateBeer when I purchased the bottle, but apparently B. Nektar and Kuhnhenn have now relegated this back to the #3 mead in the world. Cool corked 750 ml bottle with red wax, purchased 15 months ago at Bine & Vine ($46.99). Pours at room temperature a red - brown - dark amber color that looks almost exactly like brewed tea and with no foam/head whatsoever. AROMA of port, candied raspberries, dark honey, cinnamon schnapps, raisin, stickly treacle / molasses, with a noticeable sweet alcoholic heat. FLAVOR has much of what is found in the nose with notes of port wine, Red Hots cinnamon candy, sticky raspberries and raisins, maple, thick caramel and molasses, and some warming alcohol. Finishes sweet (more port notes) and with a lightly burning cinnamon sensation. Its boozy and sweet, but with lots of great underlying complexity. I am admittedly not rating to style (as this is only the second time Ive ever had mead), but simply on my subjective enjoyment of the beverage which was significant. I quite like good port and other dessert wines, so this was right up my alley. Certainly a sipper...this bottle should last me quite a while. Thanks to Geoi at Bine & Vine for procuring this rare treasure. (493, 800)

Auburn with a red tint. Smells of cinnamon, liquor syrup, nutmeg, cloves, Christmas cake (fruit cake). Full syrup oily body. Apricot, caramel/treacle/molasses or is it maple? Sweet sticky, sherry. Beautiful. So high quality, its on a quality of its own. Like drinking liquid honey.

Pour from someone at the Stone Sour Ale Fest 2013. Deep dark golden pour. Lots of honey flavor, notes of berries, raisin, musty oxidation, and vanilla. Very sweet, and warming alcohol. Good stuff, but not really my cup of tea.

Warm reddish brown colour, no head. Aroma of walnut, warm wood notes, alcohol, honey, light fruity touch. Sweet flavour, honey, maple syrup, raisins and vanilla. Full body. Sweet honey finish, caramel, lingering alcohol and raisins.
Very, very nice, in a dessert wine way. Good to nip and savour, but wouldnt want to drink a whole bottle the whole evening.
(From 250 mL bottle shared @ Oirschot tasting. Thanks for getting me this one, Tim!)

Bottle shared by Martinus. Clear red color. Nice aroma of sweetness and alcohol. Taste is incredibly sweet and alcoholic. No idea how to rate this, totally not experienced when it comes to meads. Not bad though, but too sweet for me to really like it. The aroma is pretty nice I think but the sweetness is too much. Its like pure honey with alcohol. Dont know what to think of this, but its not bad. Not really my thing though.

Bottle @ benzai thx to martinus. Dark amber colour with no head ofc. Smells alcohol, caramel honey, cherry, sweet, wood. Tastes very sweet, honey, deep flavour, a bit alcoholic, some wood, slightly walnut/hazelnut. It?s great but a bit too alcoholic for me. Full body and warming.

250 mlk tasting bottle. Hugely rich honey nose, well aged and mellow, oxdized like a sherry. Deep orange amber with oily clear around the edges. slightly thick. Big honey flavor, sweet orange, alcohol, flowers. Very full and rich. Silky, oily, velvet. Excellent stuff. Had side by side with Kurpiowski, which has a lighter and fruiter flavor. That one is easier to drink a lot of, and lighter, this is very rich and good for a small snifter, lovely.

Bottle shared by DrSilverworm at Natifest 12 (from notes). Pours a clear amber color with 0 head.  The aroma and flavor was sweet honey as I would expect, but this had so much more.  Berries, vanilla, and some alcohol.  This is as advertised and I look forward to trying this again.

Bottle. Pours clear reddish amber, ruby when held to the light. Aroma is very honey, raspberry, touch of woodiness, spice. Very sweet honey and raspberry dominated, with a whiskey like note. Full bodied, syrupy mouthfeel. Not carbonated. Warming finish. Interesting desert mead.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Dobry wyrob pszczelarski. Pelnia slodyczy i miodu. Miod jest mardzo bardzo intensywny. Ma sie wrazenie jakby sam miod sie pilo tylko zadszy. Kolor intensywnie brazowo-pomaranczowy. Zapach miodu wiadomo. W tle ukryty alkohol ktorego sie nie wyczuwalo. Smak dodanego soku takze lekko jest zaznaczony, ale malo jest wyrazisty bo miodu jest ok 3/3 objetosci. Polecam.
Sample.  Thanks Tom!  Pours a golden amber.  Aroma of honey, dark fruit,  florals, and alcohol.  Taste is honey, cherries, berries, and a touch of alcohol.  Very warming.  Best Mead I have tasted.
Bottle thanks to weihenweizen. Pours a dark, still copper color. Aroma is rough alcohol. Taste is very sweet and smooth. Very good in the finish. Almost fruity.

Chilled 1 L glass bottle, not like the picture shown, poured into a snifter.  Pours clear light red, medium body, and texture is extremely syrupy.  Taste starts off off, then goes to big honey, and finishes nice raspberry honey.  I thought I would like this more, based on the ratings.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20110123.
Pours clear golden color with no head. Aroma of honey, some ripe sweet fruits, mild caramel and alcohol. Flavor is pretty much the same with some sweetish berries. Nice.
Bottle courtesy of Yespr. Clear amber with no head. Aroma is honey, fruit, dark fruits, herbal and a little perfume. Flavour is honey, dark fruits, herbs, warming, sherry, little sugar and plume.
Bottle courtesy of Yespr. Thanks a lot! Clear amber without head. Aroma is sweet, honey, herbal and alcohol. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 150313

75 cl bottle at home. Golden, oily liquid, completely still. Super sweet and heave on the nose with tons of roses, honey and  berries. Mouthfeel is smooth silk and the taste explodes with honey, roses, rosehips, red berries and warming alcohol. Warming finish. Amazing mead.

Golden amber color. Flat, no carbonation. Cherries, honey, apricot, hints of wood and Chinese liquor (biajou) tempt the nose. Very well balance, never too sweet or cloying. Alcohol well hidden. A touch syrupy. Very smooth. Lingering sweet honey and cherries in finish. A touch warming. Excellent.

0,75l bottle. Copperbrown, no foam at all. Aroma: Honey, toffee and sweet wine. Taste: Lots of honey, sherrywine, candy and dark fruits. Very full body, oily and sticky texture. Long sweet end. Very tasty mead!

Possibly my favorite mead at the mead fest.  I got no rasberries at all which is strange.  What I did get was tons of rich maple, raisins, and honey.  Just packed with flavor with a thick luxurious mouthfeel.  Loved it.
sample at the meadfest at Julio,s, this one was very rich and chewy. Tons of raspberries, really like it.
The last few ounces of a bottle thanks to CanIHave4Beers. Super smooth. The alcohol is very well hidden, and what is there just adds character to the raspberry. Very nectar-y.

Aroma is honey, cherry, raisins, and alcohol.  Taste is sweet and mild, with honey, maple, raisins, and some spice (but surprisingly, no raspberries).  A little spice, bitterness, and some drying alcohol in the finish.  Probably not for everybody, but I thought this was just great.

.75l bottle from Kavu
Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma is sweet. Honey, raisins and alcohol. Sweet flavor is very much honey and plums. Sweet but very nice!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Sample at ÖÖWF. Sweet smell with some brandy. Very sweet taste, fruity with lots of honey. This was like drinking liquid honey or syrup. Very special, I definitely want to drink it again, but a small sample is enough for me. Re-rated at home. It has a boozy smell but the taste is amazing. Sweet with dried fruit and honey.
0,75 l bottle from Arkadia Alko. Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma is honey, alcohol and some raisins. Flavor is honey, alcohol and raisins. No carbonation. Exquisite.

Thx Eugene/77ships ! 
Colour: golden honey amber 
Smell: honey, sweet, some caramel, booze 
Taste: absolutly delicious, dominating sweet/alcoholic, no raspberries tough, very delicious and awesome paired with roquefort !

25 cl. fles gedeeld met Belgbeergeek & Sebletitje @ Belgian Ratebeer Winter Gathering of Ultimate Evil. Bedankt Seb. dat jij mij verteld hebt waar jij dit kunt kopen. Lichtjes donker, koperen vloeistop. Aroma is boordevol met honing, helder, zacht maar lekker dik, dikke karamel, lichte eik, alchol domineert lichtjes maar dit is niet al te storen en valt best te verwachten. Zachte, dikke, lichtjes olieachtige honing, dik, rijk aan suiker, heerlijk zoet met een prachtig blijvende honingzoetheid in de mond, fruit is minder uitgesproken dan verwacht maar geeft wel een mooi fruit likeur toets aan het geheel, frambozen zijn subtiel, getemd, heerlijk, lichte zoete kruiden en eiken toetsen. Vol, slik, lichtjes olie achtig, de meed blijft echt aan de binnenkant van het glas plakken  absoluut heerlijk  prachtige honingwijn. Pure klasse.

Bottle at the Colorado Mead Tasting 12, courtesy of Armin. Thanks Man! Pour is deep copper with no head and good legs. Raisins, spiced rum, honey, figs, a touch of raspberry, and maple syrup in the aroma. Taste is sweet banana, raisins, bourbon, a touch of acid, maple syrup, wood, and light cocoa. Syrupy mouthfeel with no carbonation. Great mead!

Colorado mead tasting 2012 - cloudy dark copper - nose of brown sugar, date, maple, raisin, fig - slick, smooth mouthfeel - a little boozy, but that is really the only drawback - flavors of raisin, fig, overripe banana, rum, molasses - finish of spiced rum - really tasty stuff.

Bottle, 16%. Good sweet and vinous aroma, quite boozy in the late nose. Clear dark copper, almost brown colour. Extremely sweet flavour, nicely spicy. Mild alcohol burn in the finish. Oily texture. Liquid candy.
Perfect copper colour. Boozy but not aggressive aroma of well matured honey. Sweet taste of honey and oak. Rich, a little oily finish. Really good.

Small 25cl bottle - Apis gift pack found at a honey shop in Brussels.
Ambrée/cuivrée, huileux sur le verre.
Arôme est assez terreux avec un miel très agréable, note sucrée/caramel avec un rappel très fleuri et ce bouquet de miel fermenté nettement plus en avant que sur la version Kurpioswki essayée en parallèle. 
Palais est doux avec des notes de candi sucré tout en gardant le profile épais du miel.
Palais reste huileux avec ce fini sur des notes de sucre caramélisé, moyennement sec. 
Se boit plus en digestif et qcq cl suffisent.

Pours a pretty deep, not quite blood red color. 

The aroma is pungent and chock full o honey. Im catching only a minimal amount of fruit in the aroma, however there are some oaky spicy almost tequila like notes to the aroma. Some limestone is in the aroma as well, but one thing is sure the thing smells huge and rich. 

The flavor is incomparable, simply unique... far too acidic to compare to any of the dessert wines Ive had, but I also know precious little about these wines. This is obviously far closer to a dessert wine than anything that Ive come to know as "Mead" living in the Midwest United States. The honey is the dominant flavor, but the fermentation is very clean and the alcohol character, while noticeable provides a light spiciness and warmth as opposed to any real "boozy" elements. The raspberry flavor is subdued but ever present. The oakiness is mild but certainly contributes well to the character of the Mead. Some sort of fortified wine character, but this is not nearly as boozy or sweet as many of those.  

The palate is absolutely huge, sharp at the front but also enormously viscous and mouth coating. The finish is long and the flavor of the mead lingers and lingers. 

Ridiculous.
Sample @ SBWF 12. Clear amber colour without head. Rich sweet fruity aroma. Sweet honey flavour with some spiceness.
snoop doggs favorite mead sampled at brewfest. Amber, no head, clear. Reminds me of eating honey packets at KFC but with booze added. Sherry influences are real with this whoa.

Amber colour with no head. Fruity aroma that reminds me of sherry. Aslo a bit sour. Sweet and fruity flavour. Oily texture. Drinkable in small kvanta.[Small bottle from Frykas Sklep Spozywczy in Old City Warszawa, Poland]

Bottle at Natifest 2012.  Thanks to DrSilverworm for bringing it.  Honestly, one of the best meads I have had. Smooth and rich with citrus and dark fruits.  The raspberry in not hard to find.  Awesome.

Bottle in the wooden cage, shared at Natifest. Big thanks to radarsock for this. Clear reddish brown color. No head. Wow, what an aroma. Such a rich, raspberry honey flavor. Thick, big body, kind of viscous, but it works wonderfully for the rich flavor of this mead. Like nothing else Ive had. Awesome, endless honey sweet aftertaste. Such a good one to share. Little hotness in the finish, but for 16%... Its totally fine. Definitely best mead Ive had, I think. One to savor, super-interesting. Like liquid candy.
Bottle to taster at Natifest (thanked DrSilverworm). Looks good; reddish-brown and still. Smells and tastes solid; sweet, fruity and boozy. Mouthfeel is good. Nice.

Finally got to try this badboy, expensive, but with a try at least once.  Aroma was of honey, raspberries, light cofee, and chocolate too.  Flavor is toffee, honey, coffee cream and light chocolate. Lots of stuff going in here, hard to pick out all of them. Great stuff and worthy of the praise.

Yowza!  Just yowza!  Huge thanks to kiefdog for bringing this one and sharing it around.  Pours a hazy yellow-gold with pink highlights.  Nose is a burst of raspberries to the nectar, honeycomb, and beautiful Polishness of this mead.  Flavor is similar- the base mead shines wonderfully as the deep and earthy raspberries shine through this one.  It is boozy and formidable like a fine spirit.  Full in body for a mead and truly unique in the world of meads.

Wow, this mead was amazing, poured an amber color, aromas of honey, flavors are honey, not overly dry, not overly sweet, spot on.  This was shared at Markwises bday bash, big in abv, but sure didnt taste like it, this was great stuff.
Bottle at James place. Pours amber with no head. Sweet honey, light spices, sweet caramel candy. Just a hint of booze, but in a good way. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2012 Excellent - rich and decadent. Very sweet and full - but I never felt over whelmed. Thick pour - a bloody red colour. Lots of honey and the raspberry is a nice accompaniment.  Some woody flavours too. All well integrated in a big, bold fantastic that shows depth in the aging process. An unmissable experience.

75 cl bottle (or what was left of it) @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 22.01.2011
Aroma is sweetish with honey and some alcohol. Flavour is very sweet and rather rich on honey, some sugar and warming alcohol. Alcohol is also stinging on some sips. My first touch on the real Meads, nice.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2012 750 mL bottle.  Pours a clear, still reddish brown.  Aroma is extremely potent, ridiculously sweet honey and raspberry.  Flavor is again powerfully sweet honey, hints of berry, herbal hints blending into an overall dusty oxidative tone.  Hints at its alcohol content only with the intensity of the flavor.  Ridiculously sweet and equally tasty.

Update: After a couple days in the fridge, this has oddly gotten even better.  The dusty flavor I described as oxidation is totally gone, and its only better now!
Bottle. Pours clear golden with no head. Tastes super sweet of honey and fruit. Tastes almost no aslcohol. Thick and incredibly smooth.

This stuff is dangerous. pours a thick syrupy consistency. smell of rich honey with moderate notes of raspberry and a port like oxidized notes. overall smells sweet. taste is uber-rich honey and a balanced raspberry note and a hint of oxidation adding complexity. Taste is mostly honey with a compliment of fruit. There is indeed a bit of acidity keeping things from being too sweet. Overall very sweet but something just makes me want to keep drinking. Thoroughly enjoyable!

Small bottle (Thanks, Basia - you came through in the end).  Earthy, fruity raw honey and alcohol aroma.  Chestnut brown color.  Smooth sweet honey flavor with hint of raspberry in the finish.  Full bodied.  Lives up to the hype - wonderful.

This has te color of darkish maple syrup. Walks down the side of the glass. Nose is intense honey, wax, flowers, sweet fruits, and various sweet fruity and sugary nuances. Flavor is intensely sweet homes some touch of fruit and alcohol. Thick feel. Nice but aroma is superior.
shared by jtc-bottle-pours amber that sheets the glass and no head.  Aroma is sweet medium malt, some herbal/honey sharpness.  Taste is very sweet medium malt, raspberry, 2nd sharpness.

Bottle at home. Brandy like color with no head. Very intense dark honey, berries, sherry. Full sticky mouthfeel. Very sweet taste, lasting honey, flowers, raspberries. Long aftertaste. Hands down best mead I ever had.

Bottle thanks to pepsican - also shared by Steve. Pours reddish amber. Nose/taste of caramel apple, fresh raspberry puree, raw honey nectar and vanilla. Ultra smooth and delicious. Sweet finish with mild alcohol burn. Full mouth feel.

Bottle.  Clear amber pour with no head.  Burns the nostrils a little kinda like Grand Mariner.  All kinds of honey, raspberry, and orange aromas.  Rich caramel, honey, and raspberry notes.  Outstanding...
Only a sherry aroma but the mouthfeel is wow! So soft and silky, how can something be so sweet but not sticky. Red fruit and obviously mega honey taste. Just 100ml is enough. Fantastic!

Wee dram of this, courtesy of Armin and Aaron. Poured a hazy golden and and still as can be. Taste is thick and rich honey, mild notes of alcohol and a syrupy goodness. Warming throughout with a cinnamon and orange fruit finish. Crazy stuff. Must try again.
aroma of sherry. clear amber color super sweet and caramel flavor what a great mead

Bottle. Pours a clear amber color with no head. Has a fruity spicy slightly dusty honey aroma with berry hints. Sweetish spicy honey and raspberry flavor. Has a sweetish spicy honey finish with hints of raspberry.

Bottle @ Dans house, courtesy of Armin. Huge thanks! Dark caramel, orange brown appearance. Quite rich, raspberry, somewhat spicy, nice honey aroma. Very rich, syrupy mouth feel. Rich, almost cinnamon like spicy, raspberry, super rich honey flavor.

0.5l bottle @ RBNAG11. Pours a lovely woody-nutty-red body. Fantastic aroma with wood, tons of honey and some nice horse-like hints in the background. The flavors are sweet and extremely nice! Wood, raisins-peal, cherries?, straw and its just a fantastic flavor bomb! Im shocked how good this sweet and sticky stuff actually can taste. Three thumbs up!

Shared ceramic bottle at the RBNAG-11 grand tasting. Clear copper. Headless. The fruity nose does not really prepare you for the wonderful sweet, fruity, honey flavors. Smooth. Full bodied. Delightful - Id love to have more of this one.

Shared bottle at RBNAG 11 @ Haandverkerstuene, Oslo. Been looking forward to this one ever since it was published for the gathering: the worlds top ranked mead! :-) Lets see if theres any substance to the claim. First off all: the looks on this thing is simply fantastic. A deep amber-hued clear golden body with a coppery hue resides majestically in the glass, reminiscent of a tropical sunset. It really looks like some kind of cognac or fine brandy rather than fermented honey. :-) Nose is complex layers of heather honey, rose, raspberries, syrup and vanilla. Hints of wood and caramelized sugars. Taste is equally nice; super-sweet, sticky tones of intense honey, flowers, raspberries and vanilla with hints of wood, syrup and mild straw. Mouthfeel is compact and sweet, and this is nothing you can down a pint of at any point but then again: thats not the point. Delicious aftertaste of rose petals with hints of red berries. Absolutely stunning and a real eye-opener; I never knew that a mead could be this sweet, complex and enjoyable at the same time. Need to get more of this for sure. And I am now officially a fan of (good) meads! :-D

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2011 Wonderful stuff.  Pours a nice dark color.  Honey sweetness the type that can only be found in polish mead.  So rich and sweet with a bit of earth.  Loads of brown sugar, sweet caramel.  Hints of Light berry and vanilla.  Rich thick and sweet.  Best enjoyed an ounce at a time.

Shared bottle at RBNAG-11. Pours amber, with a very low viscosity and no head at all. Aroma of honey,almonds, sweet berries. Taste is sweet and mellow, flowery malts and honey, very smooth and wonderful taste. Very sticky mouthfeel.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2012 Clear dark red.
Aroma: dried fruits, honey.
Taste: very sweet but somehow that works really well, honey, raisins, brown sugar.
Sticky mouthfeel.
This was really nice!

Trade with Boltz7775.  The aroma is honey, raspberry, wood, flowers.  The appearance is a deep but translucent amber, no head.  The flavor is honey, raspbrry, other fruits, alcohol.  The finish is sweet, light booze burn.  The body is thick, sticky syrupy mouthfeel.  Offbeat for a beer drinker.  Very sweet and sticky.  But really enjoyable.  Thanks, jason.

Pour out of awesome looking bottle into snifter, nice deep ruby red with some orange hints on the outside.  Obviously no head, alcohol legs very present and lasting very long.  Pretty nice looking for a 16% mead.  Aroma is awesome, even if a bit sharp from the alcohol its to be expected.  There is notes of raspberries, floral, the honey is high quality with it smelling like the raw beehive honey.  Taste starts out with some sweet raspberry and floral notes, the sweet versions of that for sure, and dives right into the honey afterwards.  Nectar honey with lots of sweetness but also the rawness of it really makes it tasty.  There is a ton, TON, of honey in this and it really makes it sweet but thats what they were going for.  Slight retronasal burn but no alcohol in the taste, and a slight warming in the belly.  Palate is not too thick to prevent too much coating, but is nice and makes the taste last.  Too easy for a 16% mead, while this is on the sweet spectrum of meads it is done perfectly for that style.  Worth the price, seek this out.

750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Red, clear liquid wit no head. Aroma of raw sugars, honey, alcohol and some raspberry. Taste is sweet and tastes a lot of honey, no alcohol at all. No bitterness or sourness. Medium to full bodied with no carbonation and really sticky mouthfeel. Extremely well tasting, best mead Ive ever had.

Extremely sweet, but also clearly complex and hte best mead I have had. Not sure if I can taste or smell  rose (even though it is distinctive) but the raspberry is clear int he aroma and flavor. Honey and more (fruity) to the sweetness. Slight warming from the alcohol but not serious. Not herbal like some meads. Good, but who can have more than 150 ml at a time of this stuff. Lovely dark color...
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: JaBier done gave me diabeetus too! This Mead is a clear reddish-orange color. Sticky coating on the glass. Honeycomb aroma with notes of berries. Rich and somewhat syrupy body with flavors of sweet honey, mildly tart fruit and a touch of liqueur which keeps it from becoming cloying. Even with that however this is definitely a sipper, a very enjoyable sipper. The finish coats the tongue and leaves a lingering sweet honey aftertaste. Very good all around.

Bottle purchased at Knightly spirits. Pours a reddish copper color. Very viscous texture, completely coating the glass. Nose is super sweet honey, with berry and slight floral notes along with some booziness. Flavor is ... WHOO-WHEEEE! I thought Kurpiowski and Empire were rich and sweet, but this is diabeetus (as Wilford Brimley would say) in a glass. Anyway to be more specific, the flavor starts with candied berries and honey with a sticky sweet fruit syrup finish. A sipper for sure and a definite onslaught on your sweet taste buds, but its quite delicious.
Sweet raspberries and alcohol on the nose.  Raspberry and smooth honey sweetness on the palate.  One of the better meads Ive tasted.

A ton of sherry notes on the nose. Aromas of raw honey. Has a strong garnet color. Sweet from unfermented honey but not cloying. Raspberry is subtle with the notes of sherry and raw honey the most prominent. This is a very good mead and worth every penny. I believe Heart of Darkness is a bit better offering a far wider spectrum of fruit. Highly recommended either way.
Bottle.Pours reddish amber .Aroma of honey, raspberries, flowers , spice and red berries.Flavor is sweet and sticky with a lot of honey and berries.Full body, warming.Very nice and smooth mead.

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma has notes of honey, berries and nuts. Taste is heavy sweet. Body is full, texture is sticky, carbonation is flat.

Bottle shared by Enjoyit. My first mead ever. Aroma has wild honey, hay, stable, flowery, caramelized almonds, vanilla, nuts. Taste is very sweet of course, flowery, slightly nutty, wild honey, maybe a hint of nuts.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2015 My first mead ever. Pours amber with no head. Aroma is wild honey, walnuts, earth, caramel, light floral and sweet vanilla. Taste is honey, caramel, maple syrup, brown sugar, weak raspberry, nuts and cognac. Thanks to Enjoyit for sharing.

25cl bottle from Krakow side-by-side with Kurpiowski and Lubelski. I just dont think Im a big enough mead fan/connoisseur to do these bottles justice. Glad I got them for about 20 Zloty and not some huge stateside markup. I did think the Apis was my favorite though. The color was darker but also had more red tint to it. I could actually smell the raspberries. The flavor was similar to the other 3 but I think I could pick up the faint fruit in the finish. Probably better as an aperitif....in small doses.

Raspberries are present but faint; certainly very sweet, almost entirely too sweet, but remains drinkable.  Not a big mead person so this one is largely lost on me.  Thank god I got this in a 14 dollar taster flight rather than paying 40-50 dollars for a bottle.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2011 750ml woven bottle, very sweet honey and boozy, definitely a sipper, very sweet, full with a hint of raspberry on the back end. Very nice, but Im not sure that I would buy a whole bottle at $40 again. Still Splended.
Fra flaske,dufter dejligt af frugt, honning og lidt"skarp" flot cognac gylden med " gardiner" ! Smager dejligt ! Af honning og cognac! En super dejlig mjød næsten perfekt!! ;)

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2012 Big thanks to Dan for sharing. 
Poured a dark copper colour, very viscous body. Aroma is berries. floral honey tones, slightly earthy and waxy.
Flavour had a medium sweetness. nice ripe berry, smooth honey, amaretto/alc presence. very enjoyable.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of honey and slight alcohol.  Poured deep amber/orange in color with a no head.  Clear.  Not sparkling.  Flavor is heavily sweet.  Tastes of honey.  Full body.  Smooth, slick, slightly viscous texture.  No carbonation.  Heavily sweet honey finish.  16%ABV is slightly present in the nose, but not in the flavor.

Bottle kindly shared by plovmand, thanks, its very appreciated body! ;) 
It pours a nice dark amber/mahogany colour. 
The aroma is not as sweet honey like as expected but has notes of ripe ripe fruit, berries and alcohol as well. 
The flavour is sweet and dry wit hints of honey and alcohol but dominated by port, dates, berries and fruit. 
Finished sweet and dry with a super nice balance.

@ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Thanks oh6gdx!
Clear reddish brown colour without a head. Aroma of strong sweet fruits, syrup and honey. Flavour of sweet fruits, syrup, toffee and wood. Very sweet on the palate with some acidity too. Im not a big fan of mead but this was good.

Bottled. Thx. Plovmand for sharing. Amber coloured. clear. no head. honey sweetness, spice, apple and some ripe fruits like prunes and raisins in the aroma. Flavour of sweetness, spice, apple, honey and prunes.  medium to ful bodied. Sweet and honeyish end. smooth nice. Really a treat and definately in the most high end of the style.

Trade from Hopscotch. Thanks a million my friend! Pours cognac amber. The aroma has loads of ripe fruit, honey, spices, warming alcohol, berries and sweet caramel. The flavour is sweet fruit, port, berries, light acid, caramel, syrup, dates, dark honey and ends up with a sweet fruity kick. Thick and smooth palate. Very very nice!! The hype is well deserved.

Paid $40 for this a few years ago at Astor Liquors. Poured out a golden honey color, no carbonation whatsoever. Aromas are of raspberries soaked in grain alcohol, some honey aroma, slightly almond like Amaretto. Flavors are all over the place, with alcohol being the foreleader. Some almonds, raspberries and vanilla.
Decent mead overall, but potent. Watch out for this one.

kindly shared by jens ungstrup @ an ungstrup tasting
clear amber no head.
aroma of honey and fruits, 
flavor is honey, spicy strongness but not bitter.  fruity sweetness balances the honey sweetness. other flavors reminds me of port wine, red berries, wood.
Bottle thanks to Nates mate Jason at The Euston Tap opening.  A little musty on the aroma.  Lovely raisin fruit throughout.  I managed to hoover up a few glasses of this.  Lovely mead.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2010 Thanks to the legend which is Jason.

I confess that I have NEVER had Mead before so this is a first. However as I am new to this style I anticipate this rate as a total screw up! 

Toffee; caramel, almonds, ethonal, raw alcohol, alcohol is not disguised at all,  intense flavour on the palete, red copper colour. Too intense for me but I can see the niche and appreciate the extreme length gone to acquire this beer. I owe you one mate. Yes.

Huge thanks to daknole! Bottle pours copper.  Aroma shows notes of honey, raspberry, maple syrup, booze, and rose petals.  Flavor shows the same with additional notes of baking spices.  Overall body is full, viscous, sweet, and flat.  Delicious.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2011 Got this on tap at Vintage estates, really nice palce. I got #1 meade from #1 place, makes sense. Reddish orange sweet honey flower rose smell, yum. First taste is rather spicey hot cinnmon sweet fruity palate with honey, yea. Finish is sweet and friendly without being cloying. Strong when compared to beer and flat as well. Overall good meade experience. Cool that vintage has a meade tasting rack.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Glass (4 oz.) for $5 at Hop Leaf Chicago, an unbelievable bargain! Apparently in addition to the cool description given above, this also is aged for 5 years in oak. Dark orange amber, no head whatsoever. sweet honeycomb and syrup aroma, hints of flowers. Incredibly sticky, syrupy-sweet honey and toffee flavours, with floral and dark fruit elements. This plays out like a fine tawny port combined with an icewine. Decadent, rich, and very interesting.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours a syrupy brown. Aroma is Raspberry, Booze, Maple Syrup, Rock Candy, Spices, Herbs. Flavor is Raspberry, Booze, Maple Syrup, Rock Candy, Spices, Herbs. Extremely thick and you cant drink much of it but its quite tasty. Burning alcohol sensation in the finish. Respect!@

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 Rerate Bottle at ÖÖWF cons 2012-11-16 Örebro
AP: amber, no head
AR: warming feeling, nutty, rosehip soup (nyponsoppa),
F: sweet, velvet, nutty, honey, caramel, oaked, grainy
New rating: 3,9 = new average 3,8!

Sample from bottle at SBWF 2010, cons. 2010-10-08 Nacka
raspberries, rose hip buds, round, strong alholic flavor, sweet sugary
one of my favorite meads, its also one of higher priced but still worth of buying.
Bottle shared by Daknole  - thanks Dak!  Pours clear amber.  Nose is honey and booze.  The  taste is honey, rock candy, fruit and walnuts.  Medium ily mouthfeel.  Very good.

Generously shared by Dak...thanks again!!!  Beautiful copper/honey pour that fills the glass without a head.  Aroma is caramel, toffee, molasses, and a little ripe dark fruit.  Flavor also shows maple and port-like qualitities.  Thick as syrup and has sugary legs.  Really tasty and glad I got a chance to try this one.

Thanks to bavarianpurity wherever you are! What an experience. This stuff is so good, but I think if you sampled more than 2 ounces at once, youd go into a diabetic coma. Its freakin sweet! It pours thick like honey and has a beautiful reddish copper color with obviously no head or bubbles at all. The nose is extremely potent and complex with alcohol, sherry, honey, plums, oranges, and berries. The flavor is ultra sweet and syrupy with honey, plums, raspberries, and alcohol. Just take 2 ounces at a time, recork it and lay it down for weeks or even months. It stays real nice. A treat for sure.

Half of a bottle generously donated by tarheels86.  Thanks man.  Finally getting around to rating this after a few glasses in the last few months.  This stuff is truly god-like honey nectar.  Aroma is enormous and rich with deep filling honey, liquor, sweetness that I assume comes from the raspberries, slightly bready.  Seriously, the smell is unreal.  Taste is full bodied, palate covering, and intense with frontal notes of honey, alcohol, slightly floral, bread, and caramel.  Just an unbelievable beverage.   I actually used some of this on a peanut butter and honey (with this as the honey) sandwich on homemade bread... it was awesome.

Tasted from bottle.  Pours dark amber with no head.  Nose of honey, macerated raspberries, and a slightly herbal note.  Flavor is very sweet (cloyingly so) honey with light fruitiness and a toast finish.  Body is syrup thick with no carbonation and a long, sweet toast finish.

Wicker-wrapped bottle - I love the presentation! Pours clear orange, very syrupy, with nice legs - no carbonation, of course. The nose is big and boozy, like a sort of light whiskey, with a sweet maple syrup tone and rich fruit notes - pear, in particular. Flavor is extremely rich and sweet, nice and boozy - rather hot and alcoholic, but in a good way. Sticks very heavily to the palate. An experience, to be sure - its rather difficult to describe just how unique and amazing this mead is. Definitely one of the richest and most flavor-filled beverages Ive experienced.

This is a delicious cordial/digestif. Much akin to a desert wine or sherry, but I dont think Ive had a sherry that I like so much. Phenomenal. Lots of sweetness, but balanced with a floral aspect and the mellowing of the barrel aging. Also, this mead seems to share a specific flavor with all De Dolle beers; I am not sure what it is, or why.

BA review: 05-06-2007 

The bottle ive had sitting on the shelf finally gave me a sign today to open it. It slipped, landed on the floor, and smashed the red wax seal on the front. Miraculously, the heavy bottle was still intact, leaving a dent in the wood floor. 

4oz. serving in a shotglass. Crystalline amber jewel tone. Legs appear with a gentle swirl of the glass. 

Aroma is potent, raw honey, with a toned down indication of its high-octane nature. Slight oak-barrel woodiness in the background. 

Syrupy, sticky, and palate-coating. Raw honey, clover, oak, and candy sweetness. Slight heat from the abv, but not overpowering in small sips. Wouldnt want more than a tiny sample once and awhile. Great digestif/nightcap, despite the sugar rush...

Bottled. A deep red-brown mead. The aroma has strong notes of honey and pollen. The flavor is very sweet - though not cloying with strong notes of honey, spices, and alcohol, leading to a sweet, but dry and spicy finish.

Thanks SpencerDB. Translucent copper amber pour. Nose is super rich and complex, odiative sherry and port notes, raisin, warming alcohol, caramelly sweetness. Flavor is rich and sweet, warming, raisiny, dark fruits, port, oxidation/sherry quality. Thick coating mouthfeel with a nice warmth.

Amber color, no head; aroma is honeyish, berryish and slightly herbal; flavor is pure honey, very sweet but never cloying, light balancing herb notes, also slightly berryish, most evidently in the aftertaste; full-bodied and very smooth, not so sticky as one would probably expect. If you dont love honey, you probably dont love this, but I assume thats highly hypothetical situation.

750 ml wicker-covered bottle via trade with daknole- thanks again, Dak!  I opened this one at DLD 10 and made sure everyone in my immediate area got a sample.  Good thing you dont really need that much of this one to get a good feel for it.  Pours a viscous gold color with ruby highlights.  Aroma of honey, maple syrup, cognac, and raspberries.  The flavor follows suit closely, with a super thick, syrupy honey base, some definite raspberry accents, and warming alcohol.  Full-bodied, with a thick, mouth-coating syrupy feel, no carbonation of course, and sweetness all the way through.  Drinking this is a really unique, interesting, enjoyable experience.  People seemed to be really receptive to it, both those who had some experience with meads before and those like me, for whom this was their first try of mead.  Ill be getting this again to share in the future because, wow, its incredible.
Thanks to Spencer for sharing this one!  Still copper pour with a rich truffle like aroma.  Very earthy and fruity nose.  Flavor is raspberries, honey, and figs.  Warm sherry like finish

Pouring at Hop Leaf.  Pours a clear light oaky brown.  No head, very still. Smokey and toasty.  Aromas of sweet honey, very sweet smelling, light chestnut aromas, toasty.  Smells and tastes a little like tamarind. Now I want a samosa.  Very sweet, very smooth, supple.  Nutty chestnut flavors, cherries and vanilla.  Rather sweet, and the tamarind comes back more. Medium bodied.  Silky.  Cloyingly sweet. Candy, toffee.  Sweet lingering roasted chestnut finish, with some crackers.  This was decent, but I struggled to finish it.  Luckily, my friend polished (no pun intended) it off for me.

Bottle shared by phaleslu at DLD 2010.  thanks Peter!  Easily the best of the handful of meads Ive had.   Would have liked to try this under different circumstances- i.e. not after 2 straight days of huge beers, but only so much time to try so many beers.  some other time.  Anyways, this was damn tasty.  I believe few words I scattered down wont do this mead justice.   Ill rerate once i try this in a more appropriate setting.

Finally getting around to rating this classic.  Bottle shared by spencerdb.   Pours orange reddish with no head and adequate legs.  Nose of rich decadent honey, port, sherry, earthy, truffles.  Flavor is naturally sweet with rich honey, sone red fruitiness, more earthy flavors.  A sticky tasty treat.  Alcohol is there but not detracting.

Aroma - fermenting honey-like aroma, silage, cool evenings in the summer near an orchard, maple syrup, caramel apples..wow

Appearance - light golden body, crystal clear, still, coates my glass with an impressive eveness..stunning to look at like a beautiful sunset  in my glass

Taste - over-the-top sweetness, has the sticky calling card of honey...alcohol?  Not a blip of it anywhere.  Just a few drops completely coveres all corners of the tastebuds and it explodes into a stunning display of sweetness.

Palate - smooth, never cloying, but you know its made with honey

Overall - my first experience with a mead, and it was incredibly enjoyable, even if my blood sugar skyrocketed due to the sweetness.  Definitely an after dinner sipper or dessert drink.  Nice to know this bottle will keep after being opened.

Bottle, shared with tarheels. Pours golden with no carbonation. Flavor is super honey sweet with some floral notes. Boozy, but not too bad, especially given the abv. Reminds me of Wild Turkey American Honey.

2005 bottle courtesy of pepsican. Shared with eight of my best friends. Everyone loved it! Still plenty left too in the bottle! Pours a flat syrupy amber of God with the legs of Jessica Alba. Im no mead expert, but the legs on this are stupid insane. Aroma is fresh heather honey (really rich), maybe a touch of raspberry. Taste is thick, viscous to the point where it could just be plain honey poured into the glass. Very sweet, 16% is absent. Overall really fun- impossible to hate this.

Sample shared by daknole.  Thanks Dak!  This stuff is amazing.  Thick, sticky amber-honey color pour.  Nice aroma of honey, caramel, flowers and light fruit.  Sweet flavor cuts the alcohol presence to nothing.  So good!

2005 Bottle I think?? Thanks to BuckeyeBoy, been wanted to try this forever! - Pours thick and clear orange, completely still with no head...aroma is gorgeous, clover honey, wildflowers, innocence...flavour is a monster, rich creamy clover, honey syrup, only the slightest alcohol presence, sticky on the finish with a lingering sweetness...awesome...

Bottle - thanks to BuckeyeBoy.  Another monster bottle that Ive been dying to try.  Clear amber, no head.  Nose is a richly sweet honey and wildflower blend.  Delightful.  The taste is spot-on with the nose.  Really damn good, truly a remarkable experience.

Appearance: Pours out a clear, viscous-looking, very dark amber-hued body.

Smell: Boldly fragrant nose smelling deeply of, natch, top-shelf honey, but also fresh florals and hand-picked fruit and wafting alcohol.

Taste: Starts with a strong, rich taste of notably sweet honey. Its got a dark candy quality about it and a small amount of background toasted nuttiness. Present though restrained jelly-like fruitiness. Small snifters worth of belly warming cognac. Peppery alcoholic accents. Finishes with both warmth and sweetness to spare.

Mouthfeel: A bit beyond medium-bodied, its both smooth and sticky in the mouth.

Drinkability: Fun stuff! A beverage that could really cultivate a growing interest and fondness for meads, but would you ever find one to exceed or even match Jadwigas elegance and charm? Its doubtful.

Sampled at Binnys Glen Ellyn, IL. After Dinner Tasting. Poured a clear, thick, coating liquid with a golden amber hue, and just a few small, short- lived bubbles floating on the collar of the brew. A slight wisp of soy set me back a little, with the remainder of the aroma a pleasant, perfumy fruit, alcohol, and honey. The flavor carried over the honey sweetness with raspberry and mid-fruit notes and very warming alcohol in a syrupy bath. An excellent, warming sipper, and problem solver.

Pours a viscous ruby/port  color.  Aroma is, wow, unreal.  Rich thick honey, cane syrup, maple syrup, rum soaked raisins, prunes, cognac, honeycomb, and some alcohol.  And the flavor.  Holy shit.  This is one top rated beverage that isnt overrated...not even close.  The sweet, coating elixir hits the tongue with concentrated honey, true rich balsamic vinegar, maple syrup, berries and a really nice warm finish.  This is truly a beverage that is amazing.  Bravo.

Holy mead, Batman!  Thanks to hellbilly for sharing this one.  Pours almost like a port in color and viscosity. Awesome aroma of raspberries and honey.  Intoxicatingly sweet with the same two primary flavors and warming dose of alcohol.  Really harmonious and delicious.  Makes me want to start drinking a lot of mead.

finally pulled the trigger on this one...glad i did!.... shared with the crew on 12/20/2009.

it pours out a crazy thick and rich looking ruby shade of honey. lots of sticky legs on this beast. 

the aroma is staggering... full of raspberry jam, honey, herbs, light spiciness and flowers. not florals, straight up flower garden! im not sure if ive ever smelled a beverage as long as this one before ever taking a sip...incredible.

luckily, the flavor follows suit without disappointment. it IS intensely sweet and cloying yet it makes no difference (i cant believe i just typed that). it is so rich and amazing to make up for that fact. 

its beyond full bodied...the texture is thick and syrupy... it almost feels like it should melt in my mouth yet it doesnt. it just coats my palate and stays there... brilliant. 

what a perfect drink for a cold december night on the patio... 10/5/9.5/5/19/4.85
Bottle, in WarsawDark amber color. Intense aroma (its served too warm, in the Polish summer), alcoholic, sweet, sticky, with caramel and honey. Very good.

Courtesy of hellbilly.  What a sought-after thing this is, and for good reason - its better than honey.  Nose is baked apple, berry skin, toasted wood, and thick molten honey.  Color is a ruby-gold refractive mess with teeny bubbles that make it look like this is what preserves ancient mosquitoes.  Flavor is a starburst of more roasty, glowing honeyed berries - emphasis on the honey.  So thick and juicy you keep expecting it to fully liquefy, but it never quite does.  Masterpiece.

Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Thanks Bro! Pours a great looking deep amber/copper, very clear. Aroma is, WoW, strong honey, fruity esters, great alcohol spice that blends in very well. Flavor is no different......sweet honey, fruit esters, alcohol spiciness. Mouth feel is heavy and very smooth, just layers your tongue with flavor....Overall, holy shit this was good stuff!

Bottle picked up at Discount Liquor in Milwaukee on 12/24/2009 (not in the beer or even mead area, but on the far wall and there were two left).  Perfect honey flavor and body.  Ambrosia like smoothness, nothing harsh about it.  This is heaven.  Appearance is ruby and brandy like.  Overall - perfect.
bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. deep amber with ruby hints.  alcohol, fruits and flowers on the nose.  great on the palate and a smooth flavor of honey, fruits and a touch of flower.

Taster at the SLC tasting 2009, thanks to Eric 
Appearance: Light reddish color with no head 
Aroma: Raspberry honey and spices
Taste: Slightly sweet with honey flavors, fruit and alcohol. 
This is my first mead, this tasted awesome to me.

bottle thanks to bhensonb.  this mead is simply amazing and the best i have ever had.  poured a dark amber and had some legs that would not go away.  aroma was honey, alcohol, and some fruit.  flavor was honey, butter, and just extremley smooth.  palate was very thick and sticky.  thanks bill for the chance to try this!!
handbottle, thanks to ericandersnavy, chestnut brown pour with lasting leg,  aromas of creamy vanilla and caramel, flavors of warming honey, buttery caramel, clover, excellent mead

Thanks to ericandersnavy for managing to get a hand bottle of this guy. Dark ruby pour with excellent legs. Aroma is honey, dark caramel. Flavor is honey, clove, orangeblossoms. Nice heat on this. Delicious!

Big thanks to ericandersnavy for getting a handbottle of this. Nose is dark amber clover honey, candied apples, and straight up bees on the comb honeycomb. I wanna put this on a cornmeal muffin and make love to it. Crazy syrupy mouthfeel with thicker legs than Brandon Jacobs. The heat is well hidden and a finish of dark pulpy fruits hang on the palate. Excellent. I wish I had a water fountain in my house that dispensed this.

Bottle from Corti Bros. in Sacramento, CA. Pours a clear,  brilliant ruby. No head. But it has legs! Aromas of berry and honey.  Medium body with no carbonation. Theres a fair amount of honey. Red berry. Definitely heat. Its a sipper. With time the honey flavor really comes forth. Its either woody or nutty. Or both. Maybe a walnut note. Really smooth. Very tasty.

Bottle from pepsican.  No really.  It was one of many bonuses.  Still in the glass, little red tint to the amber.  Incredible aroma of horse blanket, wildflower honey, bit of strawberry and graphite.  Incredible.  Funky foundation, the added fruit rounds out the honey nicely to balance the funk.  Had it with a cigar earlier, stood up really well.  Now Im having it alone and the weight is apparent, very sweet coating mouthfeel that stops from being sticky. Quickly warming, the external fruit essence makes this very well rounded.

250ml bottle (Warsaw)
Deep amber, still. Sweet nutty aroma. Silky smooth sweet palate.
Retronasals beautifully nutty, woody, and clear honey-like sweetness.
Alcohol almost entirely masked by the quite sticky sweetness. Very
mellow taste, aged and nutty. Finish continues what was in the taste.

750mL wicker bottle.  Clear copper orange with what I figure are nice long legs.  Concentrated honey and wild flowers up front with some raisins and slight minerals and alcohol behind.  There is also a nondescript spice.  Flavor continues with some strange overly ripe citrus that keeps things from getting crazy sweet, otherwise its much the same--didnt really notice any raisins though.  Despite the big sweetness, I venture to say it is pretty well-balanced?  Alcohol is present but does not feel like 16%.  Big full smooth body.  A most excellent mead--best Ive had--then again, I have only had about a dozen. . . oh, and a couple ounces is plenty for a serving.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Tnx to Noize for the share. This stuff has a deep amber colour with no head and it is sticking to the glass.. It tastes very sweet and there is a lot of honey. I like it, but i dont have any clue if this is such a great mead as the ratings say it is. Whatever. Please, give me a beer.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2014 Re-rate 11/14: Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas. Clear amber. Honey. Quite heavy. 7/4/6/3/13=3.3
Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks zvikar. Dark reddish honey color. Aroma of honey, flowers, some fruitiness, caramel, alcohol and some berries hints. Very sweet flavor of honey and alcohol. Really viscous, almost honey-like, mouthfeel. Pretty tasty but too sweet to drink more than a few sips. 7/4/7/3/13=3.4

At a tasting, thanks Zvikar, clear deep brown colour, aroma of honey drops, flowers, raisins and vinous notes. flavours of honey, nuts and some spice, syrupy texture. Extremely sweet but mellow and not cloying, but sweetness is dominating and there is no acidity or bitterness to counter it, and to me that is something that sorley missed. Still a good and very intresting desert drink.

Thanks Naam, 25cl bottle. Pours sticky red to orange clear liquor. Aroma is bursting with honey well preserved without any kinky notes, some fruits like peach and apricot can be sensed as well. Flavor of honey, intense sweetness, some fruits and some acidity in the finish. Sticky mouthfeel. This is a piece of art in the sense of the brewers ability to preserve the honey aromas and flavors.

Never rated this before, odd.  Pours a rich, burnt orange, almost crystalline.  Aroma is honey, wild flowers, loads of dark fruit, oak, a slight botrytis nose, roasted citrus.  Ethereal.  The flavor is intense and warming, honey and a touch of oak.  The mouth feel is like sipping velvet,  enveloping and seductive.  Truly an amazing beverage.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2010 Had at the Hopleaf in Chicago.  Tastes like honey and smells like alcohol - wasnt blown away, but decent stuff.  I wonder if my bottle was too fresh.

Orangebrown hue.
Aroma of sweat, honey, solvent and old basement. Alcoholic.
A flavour of spices, stables, apples, smoke and rotten fruit. Sweet and alcoholic.

Bottled, i couldnt get this name out of the things i had written down, but im glad Noize did :P. Clear orange brownish color, short head. Aroma of honey, caramel malt, liquor. Thick, bit alochol, sweet, honey. Not a beer, but I actually pretty much liked it.
Copper colored brew. Alcoholic and sweet honey in the aroma. Very thick, very sweet, lovely honey flavor! Enjoy slowly, sipping. Honey is slowly getting down to the bottom of the glass. Love it.

Aged 6 years...  2002(?) Vintage
3/12/2008:  Apis Póltorak Jadwiga is medium-bodied, deep honey-colored, sweet mead that is quite complex.  It smells like a like fine honey liquour and is sweet with complexities including toasted honey comb and apple.  This mead is sweet, but isnt cloying and isnt even syrupy.  The alcohol is warming but completely absent from the flavor.  Overall this is a very impressive mead that is great for sipping and enjoying very slowly!
Bottle (Alc 16% vol.) shared by Tmoney99.  Thanks Tom!  Rating #346 for this mead.
Bottle @ kloneo. Clear amber colour, no head. Aroma is honey, sour, ammonia. Flavour is honey, alcohol, sticky and sweet. Nice to have had this one.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2013 250ml @ TheWolf. Thanks for the sample Rene. Pours clear copper - no head. Sweet candy, honey, fruit and alcohol. Low carbonation. Vinous/sherry notes. Very sweet. Quite pleasant and the best mead ive had - no question. Re-Rate. Thanks to Claus Arnsbæk. Syrupy and oily. Sweet and vinous. Lovely sipper.

Dont know enough about meads to give this a fair rating, so Ill just go with my impressions.  Thick and dark golden in the glass. Nose is honey (duh!) and hints of ammonia/cat piss.  Super sweet in the mouth, like candy.  Only got hints of the raspberries.

Bottle shared by hopscotch. Pours a thick, syrupy light copper color with no head. Very sweet aroma of honey, rasperry and alcohol. The flavor is amazing Its like a great desert wine. Sweet honey, light spices, tart raspberries and a touch of heat from tha alcohol. Amazing stuff.  This mead rocks!

Pour courtesy of Hopscotch. Holy shit!
Ruby gold color, no head or carbonation obviously. Insane raspberry and rose nose with lots of spicy honey. Flavor is just ridiculous. Very much like a decadent  desert wine. Massive raspberry honey flavor with complex notes of plum, vanilla and even some wood. The most amazing mead you could ever imagine.
