Bottle purchased for my wife on her b-day.  Man, I hate that my highest score to date is for a non-beer, but this was the nectar of the friggin gods.  Poured a thick ruddy gold. Aroma is honey, spice, alcohol and berry.  Taste is an amazingly complex blend of baking spices and honey complimented by a background berry tartness. Very port-like, but not as vinous and a different realm of sweetness. Warming to say the least.  Found that as the open bottle aged in the fridge it lost some of the complexity.  Still tasty.  I could easily drink a small glass of this every single day of my life.

My 500th rating! Bottle. Pours a deep dark amber. Aroma is a bit boozy, with honey and just a hint of tart raspberry. Taste starts a bit sharp then gets intensely sweet and rich, with huge honey flavor with a bit of flowers and raspberries. Hides the alcohol really well. Lingering sweet honey. Delicious.

Once one has tasted the sweet, heavenly nectar of real mead, there can be no going back. All other imitations pale to but a wisps shadow in comparison. With each succulent, delicate, sweet honey kiss I remember why mead was once the imbuement of choice; demi-gods, royalty, Vikingsand so on.


Liquid gold shimmers in the light with vibrant amber melting throughout her thick body. Copper glints along the sides of my glass while a heavenly aroma whispers sweet nothings to my heart. Thick, sticky, fresh honey atop a crunchy honeycomb envelops as soft warm spices of nutmeg, cinnamon, and caramelized brown sugar tease. A sense of soft wood permeates her aroma, giving Jadwiga a rustic feeling. It is liquid history I cradle in my hands so it is with somber delight I raise my glass to trembling lips. My lips glisten with the residue of her liquid bounty while my tongue is a soft sticky mess of honeycomb, ghostly raspberry, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Warmth slowly spreads from the top of my head to my tippy-toes, pervading every fiber of my being. Each sip is warm and sweet with a nip of spices in the back while delicate raspberry whispers upon a fickle wind. Her body is perfectly balanced; neither too thick nor too thin, but with just the right viscosity and stickiness. Thankfully, even as my glass empties, I still have more of Jadwigas liquid gold tucked safely away in the safe confines of her decorated bottle.


I find it unfortunate that real mead is almost an extinct spirit here in the States. I cant speak for the rest of the world, but Poland has a vibrant appreciation for meads and multiple meaderies to prove it. There is an underground, grass-roots mead movement in the states, but I have yet to taste any that could even come close to the perfection Apis has achieved. If you should come across any of their meads, bring home a couple bottles because the first will be gone sooner than you expect.

Bottle.  My first Mead.  Poured the color of dark honey, no head.  Aroma is sweet of honey and fruit possibly apples.  Wow is it sweet but not too sweet if taken in very small doses.  Flavor is soft and complex, honey, dried fruit, and some caramel overtones.  Feels like 151 going down my throat yet alcohol is very well hidden in the flavor.  I could see this being a beer drinkers Port.  Excellent actually.

[2009-20090219] Basket-woven bottle. Sherry booze aroma with sweet thick wine notes. Clear, golden amber red body with no head. Super sweet thick sherry flavour with a long sweet finish and floral grape aftertaste. Thick medium body. Not even boozy, just all sweet and goodness.
Overheard: "Me dad painted the ouse and me mam said it took the cxnt ages." -- how to use contagious in a sentence
Overheard: "The sugars making me happy." "The alcohols making me mad."
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, garthicus, GregClow, jerc)

[Bottle] shared by STLWill. Pours a glowing deep amber with amazing legs. Aroma is so dense and complex, so much going on. Lots of thick, sticky honey, woody, wildflowers, obviously alcohol, and a touch of berries. Flavor is major alcohol, super sweet and sticky with honey, florals, some berries, and more alcohol. So sweet that it makes my stomach hurt, but I just want to drink more. So velvety and rich.

1001.  Thanks for sharing Yaniv!  What a treat!  Pours a darkish golden reddish brown, perfectly still.  Full broad honey sweet.  Alcohol.  Full honey richness and yet slightly ethereal and otherworldly.  Raspberry is definitely in there.  Fuller rich flat body.  Full deep sweet honey over light raspberry.  Some brown sugar and perhaps even a slight hint of light molasses.  Treacle or demerara might be a bit closer perhaps.  Lingering honey stays for some time.  Have to drink this like good liquor!

Bottle pours dark red/amber color with no carbonation.  Aroma is strong dessert wine, or very boozy.  Pours in the glass and coats it like syrup.  When I swirl it in my snifter it has legs.  Very heavy mouthfeel.  Flavor is very complex.  Alcohol, an almond or nutty flavor, very sweet from the honey, and finishes with some alcohol heat.  This reminds me more of a Port Wine than a mead.  And its a fine one at that!

very dark amber pour, with a nose of BOOZE. ok the flavour is so complex, there is so much going on i dont know how descriptive this review will be. the aroma again, is quite boozy, but there are notes of honey, raspberries, and more BOOZE! oh, have i mentionned his smells boozy?! The flavor though is where this drink shines. The flavour is silky homey. It just coats my throat, sweet honey, mild, but also strong. There is a nice alcohol burn mixed with a nice sweet/tart berries finish. this is quite complex. there is so much moe going on but i cont put my finger on it. All i can think of is honey, berries, flowers, and BOOZE. this is an incredible drink!

Thanks to HogTownHarry. Appearance: Like a glass of port. Red, still. Aroma: Port, honey, cherry, dark fruit, like old spice. Awesome. Flavour: WOW - my teeth are going to fall out of my head... sugar, honey, maple syrup, clover, rosehip, acid. Just incredible.

Im not a big fan of sweet drinks, but this is an exception.  I like this so much I keep some of it around most of the time.  To me, it tastes like sherry wine with honey.  You sip this rather than "drink" it.  Very silky and smooth in the mouth.  So good I usually hold it my mouth a bit before swallowing.  A bit expensive but very highly recommended.  I have no other mead that come close to this.

Bottle from Piotr i Pawel, Poznan. Shared at the Italia tasting. Pours a honey golden. Shes got legs! Damn sexy ones too. Beautifully complex aroma of sweet honey, vanilla, almonds, apricot, plums, its vinous and earthy  very much like a port or sherry. The flavour is less sweet and the honey is strikingly smooth, like a dessert wine. Silky smooth on the palate and not at all cloying despite the high ABV. I cant imagine there would be a better mead out there than this.

My 800th rating.  Bottle from WLV, chicago, shared with davinci.  Dark amber red, still, huge legs that really stick to the glass. Aroma is honey, fruity, syrupy, mango, and apricot.  Flavor is mango, fruity, slight alc (really cant taste it all that much),  real jammy, not unlike a brandy, cherry, tasty.  Syrupy, med body, sticks to the mouth.  Tasty, cant taste the abv and the fruitiness is nice, even the next day.
Bottle shared at toncatchers house.  So sweet.  Serious honey aromas and flavors.  Hints of berry and other fruit.  Very very good.  I love mead, and this is the best one.

Thanks to thickfreakness for sharing some of this stuff!  
Pours an unassuming clear amber with no carbonation or head.  Smell is extremely honey like with light notes of pear and fruitiness wafting out as well.  Taste was incredibly sweet and cloying and was like chugging thinned out honey with a light fruitiness attached to it.  Syrupy body and smooth despite the 16% ABV, which was well hidden.  Still, it was incredibly difficult to drink 1 ounce over 20 minutes and was just incredibly cloying and unbalanced.  I don’t understand how somebody can complain any beer is too sweet and not claim the same for this.  Nice to try, but I can’t say I would ever want it again.

Many thanks to SoLan for the bottle. Pours clear with a pinkish amber color.   Sweet floral honey with pears, raisins, and alcohol also in the nose. Flavors of rum soaked raisins, floral honey, pears, ripe apples, and booze.  Very much like a dessert wine. Thick huge viscous mouthfeel.  Awesome stuff. I will be savoring this bottle over quite a few nights.

0.75 l bottle. Copper to amber color. Very sweet flowery aroma with hints of butter. Very sweet and honeyish flavor with dark sugar, raspberries and butter. Soft very warming palate, a bit too warming for me. This is very sweet but warming alcohol balances quite nicely.
thank you for sharing Deepak!  Never had mead before but if they all taste like this one then i’m sold!  Honey and port like - just delicious!

Bottle from a trade long ago.  What can i say the best mead i’ve ever had.   Orange amber brown body with no head.  Apple, honey, caramel apple.   The honey is lightly viscous, very sweet and dry with a mild oakiness.  Incredible.

Bottle via trade only a few months ago so I should remember who this is from.  whoever you are thank you kindly, I tried to look through trades but couldn’t recall.  Shared on the night of the debate while angrily watching mcain lie.  Pours dark orange with no head.  Nose is sweet and very very nice supremely big and full of honey.  Taste is so full of honey, I can’t really be sure i’m drinking mead, did I pour honey in my glass, hmm, nope, didn’t, this is fantastic.  This is thick and gooey and awesome, if I had this around under the counter by the gallon i’d pour this on waffles, pancakes, ice cream, you name it you go it, apis jadwiga...........

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2009 Thanks to Solan for giving me a chance to try this.  I recieved the package yesterday and just couldnt resist from cracking this open last night.  Poured a copper color, like a cognac.  Aroma was sweet, some alcohol, sweet and flowery.  The taste starts off quite sweet, maple syrup, small alcohol bite, strawberries.  Super thick, it sticks to the glass like some kind of lacquer.  The best part of this mead, as with all great drinks, is the great lasting finish.  I take a sip, swallow, and let the flavor slowly fade.  At first I found it slightly too sweet and cloying.  But after I finished my first serving, I found myself craving it an hour later, and craving it this morning as well.  I didnt imbibe, and no Im not an alcoholic, but this is some interesting stuff.  I have a feeling I might be back for a re-rate soon.
(Bottle) Cognac colour. Sweet cream cherry and honey aromas. Very sugary palate. Cherry like flavour with honey. Very very sweet.

(Bottled) Deep cognac color with no head. Dried-fruity, sweet and intense, almost malty aroma with oaky woodiness. Intensely sugary and honeyish flavor with some smooth alcohol and raspberries. Extremely thick and sugary-syrupy palate with no carbonation. Very pleasant aroma and flavor, but the sugar wall is too thick to allow sampling more than 4-6cl at once.

Bottle shared by footbalm. Pours a light copper color with no head. Interestingly, this beer leaves a silky honey coating on the glass that slowly slides down, like syrup. The aroma is very boozy; some sourness and spices, like apple cider. The taste was very sweet; a sweet honey explosion, honey glazed raspberries, smooth, very dangerous stuff. A sticky mouthfeel, lip-smacking stuff for sure. Very nice. Enjoyable and interesting. Thanks Eric.

750 Bottle thanks to pepsican. Amazing stuff. Thick pour that is an amber-rose color. Huge, perfectly formed alcohol legs. Aroma is honey, raspberries and alcohol. Taste is huge, syrupy honey, with amazingly fresh raspberry taste. Absolutely out standing. Mouthfeel is completely coating, like drinking honey. Truely the nectar of the gods!

Bottle, at cgarvieuks, with Stella, the kids, and Traci. Really great tasting Craigthanks! It was a totally unexpected surprise to be able to have a taste of this. Lovely peach color. Nose is concentrated essense of wild flower honey, and a tawny port plum quality. Wonderfully thick perfume sweetness, musky rich and luxurious.. Sweet enough to be dessert, but enough acidity and cleanness to the finish to keep it from being candy. Lovely.

No 292
Rated: 01.01.2007
Bottle brown, 250 ml
Appearance: Pours oily and sticky, heavy and full body, body hue is intensive medium to dark, very high viscosity in body texture, deep plummy red, orangy or red grapefruit like, body density is thick, body is clear, oily with distinct, sticky traces of excellent lacing on the glass sides.
Aroma: Natural honey, sweet plums, liquor, cognac, wildberries, winegrapes, strawberry, sweet brown sugar, much heavier aroma than the fresh, flowery, fruity aroma of ’Dwojniak Kurpiowski’, pine, some notes of flowers and raisin, prune, plum, wine.
Flavour: Amazing liquor, nectar and syrup, silky and velvet like palate and flavour, a great load of natural honey mixed with some fruity notes of wildberries and strawberries, cranberries, hint of lemon, vanilla, perfectly balanced flavour with amazing palate, cask wood.
Palate: Body is full, texture is 100% syrupy, finish feel is rather long, light alcoholic warmth strenghtening honey aroma dominating over the overall impression with mild pine, citrusy and fresh forest fruit nose.

8oz pour @ Hopleaf. clear copper pour. Butterscotch, maple syrup and honey are the dominant aromas. Mouthfeel is thick and viscous. Lusicous taste of honey, hint of raspberry and rose. Amazing smell. When you swirl it in the glass, it has amazingly thick legs. N ice to have tried it.

Pours a thick golden color with no head. Low carbonation. Sweet complex dark honey, plum and alcohol aroma. 
Lightly sweet, lightly bitter initial flavour. Moderately sweet, lightly bitter finish.
Little too sweet maybe but it would be nice as a dessert.

Rich copper/ruby in colour, no head, excellent alcohol legs.  The aroma is extremely powerful, lots of plums, candied sugar, honey, flowers and alcohol, quite sweet as well.  The flavour is very rich, sweet, very plummy, lots of alcohol, berries, maple and honey.  Hot sweet mouthfeel, soft body, next to no carbonation.  Finishes sweet, very warm, long.
This is just incredable, lots of alcohol but it never became a distraction because of how much else is going on here.  Just stunning stuff.
750ml bottle obtained in a trade with TheCheeseMan, thanks Dan.
Opened on January 9, 2008
No date.

Bottle courtesy of a trade with dchmela.  Pours a mostly clear clear rose tinted amber with no head.  This is a still mead.  Very strong aroma of honey with some floral notes.  The flavor is simply excellent with sweet honey and just enough raspberry to be noticeable.  This mead coats the palate with each mouthfull, but is not cloying or syrup-like.  Mild alcohol burn towards the finish does not interfere with the enjoyment of this gem.  Superb.

Thanks to Guerde for sharing this rare mead.  Amber in color and still.  Aroma has honey and some alcohol.  Incredible, intense flavor with sweet honey, prune juice, figs, sugar, and just a little alcohol, which is also present in the palate.  It reminds me of an ice wine.

Small sampler @ Kallion Poirotti, Helsinki. Deep amber color, no carbonation. Explosive aroma with plenty of alcohol mixed in with honey. Smooth, warming taste dominated by honey, sweet lingering finish. A very interesting mead that would make a great Christmas gift or after dinner treat.

Shared this with my hubby, his 500th.  Pours dark amber with no head.  Upon smelling and first taste SA Utopias pops into my mind.  Very heavy mouth feel and coats the tounge.  Sweet honey, plum and heavy alcohol.  Very smooth and warming.

Probably should have saved this for  a special rating, but I was jonesing to try it. Pours a dark brown sugar honey color, devoid of any head. Rolling around the glass shows off amazing legs. Aroma is thick dark honey, raspberry and raisin. Taste is smooth honey, not cloying at all with a little heat in the aftertaste. So smooth for so much alcohol. Stunningly smooth warmth and worth all of the hype.

No head.  Pours amber in color.  Aroma of alcohol and dark fruits.  Taste reminds me of SA Utopias.  Thick on the tongue and leaves a coating.  I can taste honey, alcohol, dark fruit like plums and raisins.  I figured this would be a good one for the 500th.

(cool looking wicker bottle from gunhaver, thanks Geiger!)  This had to be my 400th rating.  Pours dark amber and literally coats the entire glass upon swirling.  The aroma is just incredible with smells of caramel, raspberries, a lot of sweet honey, and every so often I smelled a scent of chocolate cake.  The taste was nothing short of spectacular, with raisin, honey, caramel, and raspberry all mixing together to create one of the best tasting amalgamations that has ever graced my tastebuds.  I would love to give the palate a ten on this if I could, as the whole liquid coats the mouth and leaves an amazingly long sweet raspberry finish.  This mead is just really thick and viscous.  Another amazing thing about the Jadwiga is that the 16% abv is never even noticed in both smell or taste, which is quite an impressive feat by the brewer to pull that off.  I liked this drink so much I was hesitant to even finish the rest, but smelled it for an extra ten more minutes before consuming.  This could be a dessert on its own, and is definitely in a whole other league when compared to other meads that Ive sampled.

Sampled at OSLOs and Guerdes tasting.  Special thanks to Guerde for breaking this out before I had to leave the party 
I mentioned that Guerde had this in the fridge to milkmandan and that he was going to break this out, and he practically sprinted to the kitchen in anticipation.  Absolutely divine aroma here.  I could literally smell this beer and be 90% satisfied.  Of course after going through that exercise, I needed to sip on it.  It was absolutely phenominal!  Honey, grape, dark fruits, and light raspberry flavors.  Im not too familiar with meads in general, but I really dont see how anything could beat this.  Breathtaking.

Small sample at OSLO and Guerdes tasting on Friday, 5-23-08. Thanks so much to Guerde for sharing this masterpiece. Pours copper with thick, impressive legs, Looks like an XO brandy. Honey-like, floral bouquet. Yeasty, wonderful, aroma. Very complex flavors of plum, orange, honey, and golden raisin. Its reminiscent of a great dessert wine or liqueur. This is so good!  Very thick, rich, and sticky with a good bite in the throat. I was informed that this mead would show me what constitutes a 5 for mead palate, and I was informed correctly. Its just great across the board. This is better than any beer that Ive ever had. Some beverages have the ability to be fundamentally better than others (as I know well as a whiskey fan; Ive had at least 10 whiskeys better than any beer Ive ever tasted). Perhaps mead has a higher upside than beer. Thats something I never thought Id say before I tried Apis Póltorak Jadwiga. This came very close to getting my first 5. I am holding out some hope that I will be able to rate something even more highly, but Im not holding my breath. This is a steal of a deal at just $30 a bottle. Buy it if you can find it!

Unselfishly shared by Guerde at the Spring Tasting.
Milkmandan, he of the "whatcha drinking tonight " fame told me that this was the most wonderful elixir his nose ever had the pleasure of meeting.
Whos to go against that? Gosh, this was like Emeril had done a honey reduction with some richly flavored dessert Sherry and let it enjoy years of quiet time in a bottle in a dark place for a very long time. Like chili, this apparently got better with age. No alcohol was noticable at all. I really do not know how to explain this but I can tell you that I was in total awe by this Mead.

Pours like brandy. Aroma of wine, alcohol, and HONEY! Amazing honey flavor and texture. This is like drinking thinned honey. Alcohol hidden very well. Also a bit of fruit in the background. A true sipper. Very good.

Pours the most elegant honey amber with no head. Strong strong aroma of honey and alcohol, maybe tequila. Smells like a honey comb. Taste is pure honey deliciousness. A little of the alcohol pokes through at first but the sweetness of the sugar overpowers it and lingers forever. The thick and sticky texture just clings to the mouth. Very strange, but amazing in its own right. Such a small hint of the 16% ABV in the taste!

[Bottle, thanks Guerde!] Deep viscous amber liquid that coats the glass like honey. Aroma is honey and a hint of raspberry with only a little of the alcohol that was so dominant in the Kurpiowski. Taste is the same with the raspberry slightly more subdued than in the aroma, and much more hidden than the fruit in the Kurpiowski. Really thick--pretty much just like slightly thinned down honey, and super smooth.  A very well crafted, amazing mead, but I did not enjoy the raspberry as much as the black currant in the Kurpiowski. Overall it was still slightly better though, due to the alcohol being held in check with this one.

OSLO and Guerdes Memorial Weekend Tasting, 5/23/08.  Huge thanks to Guerde.  I never thought Id get to try this mana from heaven.  It pours like slightly thinned down honey, not water with honey in it.  A single drop missed the glass and landed on my notepad where I was starting my notes for this beer.  See?  Divinely approved.  Dark copper color.  Smells of lightly toasted oak and a very dark honey.  Im not too good with my honey varietals yet, but I believe this would be a darker, more earthy kind of wildflower honey.  Ridiculously thick body.  Crushing wildflower honey taste.  Some oak and super sweet.  Bordering on a dessert wine.  While I would probably not be able to have more than a snifter full (and that would take me about an hour or two to drink), this is created by saints.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2008 Shared by Guerde and sampled at OSLO/Guerdes Memorial Day Weekend tasting. From a 750 ml basket weave bottle pours a thick and pancake syrup style mead with a clear color of deep dark gold with some red highlights. Aroma of honey and raspberry syrup, some floral herbs and character along with some multiple complex fruits of apple, oranges, apricot, and plums. Taste is thick and syrupy, quite overly sweet with flavors of rich honey, raspberry and a touch of plums. Finish is just as sweet as its flavor with a lingering raspberry syrup aftertaste that really stays around. Probably the best pour of the evening.

#1400!!  I have had this numerous times before, but have finally gotten around to rating it.  Also, it was a joy sharing it with about 5 other people who hadnt even heard of mead before, with them all enjoying it very much.  

Pours a crystal clear translucent orange amber color, with a syrupy texture.  Lovely looking.  Smells of a delicious combination of sweet honey, apples, plums, alcohol heat, and a floral meadow.  The flavor is silky smooth on the palate, just sliding along the tongue to the throat in divine fashion.  The honey is quite profound up front, really making its presence known and eliminating any doubt that it is a mead.  The fruits really are abundant in the finish.  Apples and plums, maybe some pear, and sweet nectar of the Gods all mix together to form the main balance to the intense honey flavors.  The alcohol was apparent, but took nothing away from the character or flavor of this wonderful concoction.  A truly wonderful experience.  Drinking this will never get old.

Bottle from State Line.  Pours deep gold, going toward a dark straw to light coppery honey color, with minimal head that dissipates quickly and never really returns in any noticeable amount.  The nose is luscious; honey mixed with raspberries and floral rosewater hints.  The flavor is bold, brash, pure honey mixed with a touch of raspberry notes and mild floral notes.  It does get a tiny bit hot, but that heat is integrated so well into the flavor that is never offensive.  I paid $38 bucks for my bottle, and it was worth every penny.  I dare anyone to drink this and not be tempted to utter, "Arrrrgh, ye limey bastard, Im gonna keelhaul your ass and then Ill draw and quarter ya and make ya walk the plank."  Bravo.

Pours a clear still copper. Aroma of alcohol, honey, rasberries, and green apples. Taste is smooth honey, rasperries, green apples, and just a hint of alcohol. Full sweet mouthfeel with the alcohol being very well hidden. Damn good.
A very amazing mead. A true nectar of the gods. I would rate it higher in flavor but it has a mild alcohol burn that is not masked very well. LOL

Lucky enough to try this thanks to Crosling.  My first mead as well, but I doubt it will be the last.  Poured a thick copper color.  Strong aroma of alcohol with some light honey in the background.  Flavor consists of a sweet, light honey-caramel with nice hints of berries and light apple.  Thick, slick mouthfeel.  Very, very good.  Just wish the aroma wasnt so alcohol-heavy.
Amber looking in color, no head, very intense alcoholic smell with a very light sweetness in the taste,  long lasting  bitterness and sweetness after taste

Deep, coppery red hue; still.  Big honey, butterscotch and toffee aroma...massive waves of almonds and cherries...almost a touch of chocolate...marzipan and perhaps even some liquorice.  Restrained (compared to the nose) raisin-y sweet flavour is big on the fruit (lots of cherries) and almonds.  Totally silky with a huge dessert Sherry vibe.  Full bodied with a velvety / creamy texture; still.  A remarkable piece of art, Id have taken more notes if not completely engrossed by its beauty.  Limitless depth, mind-boggling.  Thanks Jukkabro.

Dark coppery colored, no head. Well, extremely rich aroma with lots of honey, peach, raisins and nice raspberry-berriness, convenient, weirdly burning alcohol present in aroma 
also with vinous port tone. Medium to full bodied, very soft and smooth palated. Flavor is much more sweet with dominating honey and these raspberries, alcohol covered totally. Aftertaste has still dominating raspberries with sticky palate. Sugary stuff, aroma is not so sweet than flavor. Great brew though.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2008 04 Bottle:  Thanks to sprinkle for still having a few of these left at his store.  Ive been waiting quite some time to try this and finally...the time has come.  Pours a rich, deep golden color.  One of the first things I noticed about this was the transparent film it leaves on the snifter as its swirled and the aroma that hits the nose from about 10 feet away.  The initial alcohol burn invades the olfactory region and quickly fades to a rich, dark honey sensation with soft herbal-like qualities and some cream notes.  Very thick mouth feel, almost too syrup-like but still amazing.  Sweet, dark, floral honey pretty much overwhelms the taste but their are some brown sugar and ?banana? notes present that give it some additional complexity.  Well...enough rambling, this is amazing!  I naturally would prefer it to be a bit drier but thats just nitpicking...which is totally unnecessary.

Big thanks to Bdiggi66 - Right away I was blown away by the distinct aroma I have smelled before from J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Sherry). Mahogany in color. Its alchol content was not well hidden; was very overpowering at first. Very sweet and syrupy. This was an amazing experience and mead.

Bottle from Sams, Chicago. Poured clear dark golden color with good legs. Heavy woody floral honey and small alcohol aroma. Medium body with a thick smooth texture. Medium to heavy green apple honey flavor with a medium to heavy complex sweet finish of moderate duration. Pleasing smooth alcohol burn. Standout mead.

Tasting at thewolf. Pours a caramel coloured/amber. Sweet aroma of grapes and a hint of viniousness. Flavour is sweet of grapes and a nutty feel. It is sticky and well rounded and has a very nice palate.

(on bottle, thanx to thewolf) Dark, golden amber, nice. Full and warming aroma; honey, woody harbs. Incredable soft and rounded mouthfeel, smooth indeed, tha taste is more dry and carameld. The notes of dried fruits and brandy lingers for a long finish.

bottle from a trade with thecheeseman. pours a clear hazelnut with no head or carbonation or bubbles or movement what so ever. aromas are sweet with barnyard and alcohol also present. this is one of the most complex flavour profiles ive had so far. all kinds of sweet things from fruits to honey, caramel, some distinct raspberry notes, its all there in waves and swirls of flavours that dance across your palate. very drinkable, so much so i had to restrain from goin back for more and more. truley a treat!
Clear amber colour with no head. Great aroma of sweet dried fruit. Flavour of sweet apple and alcohol. Very smooth tasty and ends up very nice.

(Bottle) Pours a thick golden color with no head. Low carbonation, if any. Sweet, syrupy aroma. Taste is sweet as well, with hints of vanilla and corn syrup. Excellent palate for the style. Mouthfeel was very thick. This mead had the consistency of motor oil. Distinct alcoholic notes as well. I can appreciate this for what it is, but I likely wont be buying it again any time soon.
amber of color with no head. An aroma of port, honey, saisins and notes of alcohol. A flavor of syrup, oily and raisins. A very nice mead! And i hate honey ;-)

Reddish golden colored pour with no head  it is still.  Nose is reminiscent of Irish whiskey but sweeter.  Mouthfeel is sticky and slick, more like a liqueur than a mead.  Flavor is apples, brown sugar, and dark fruits  very nice!

I will get flamed like hell for this, but I just dont see it. The Olympic Cellars was so much more refined and subtle. Lumfest 2008- Clear brown color and smelled of communion wine. That element followed straight to the taste- strong communion wine. Flame away.

Bottle. [thank you, Aga]
[shared with enjoyit @ Ølkonsortiet]
Pours a great redish golden with no head, nice lacing of alcohol on the glass. Aroma is great, sweet but balanced. Light honey, oak, maple, port and apples. Super sticky oily mouthfeel. Very sweet flavour, raisins dominating amongst soft maple honey. Then is burns a little from the alcohol before exploding with a stunning mix of flowers, apples and light raspberries. Impressive.

I was very surprised to be able to try the top rated mead, special thanks to the folks who brought this!  Pours a clear garnet with tan highlights  and really sticky legs along the glass.  Pretty hot on the nose, but theres plenty of vanilla, maple, and rum.  Tastes sweeter than a spoonful of sugar, and damn if I didnt love the flavor.  Tons of maple, vanilla, brown sugar, honey and raisins.  Very thick, sticky, and incredibly good, unfortunately my notes dont go beyond that.  The other mead I had was Chaucers and after much though, I decided I like this better.

Basket-covered bottle, thanks to after4ever! Pours a clear reddish brown with no head but great legs. Aroma of honey and nuts. Full, sweet body. Intense, concentrated taste of honey, nuts, maybe a dash of berries. Tasty!

The Queen pours a stunning dark amber honey color with mild aromas of spice and acids. This already tells me Im in for a treat. Jad lays heavy on the palate and leaves nothing to be desired. Its luscious, chewy, and seductive. I can see why they call it the Honey Moon wine. You want dessert, well, you got it ten fold. This stuff is thick and viscous like fresh poured 30WT. Its not as complex as I imagined but tastey with a defined roasted honey component. Mildly spiced and perfectly balanced armed with its penetrating acidity. This is fat and decadent with mild nuances of candy necklace and caramel apple. The finish is long and lasting with a slight acidic twitch. Overall: Jadwiga actually lacks the strong musty tones found in most Mead. Probably due to its aging. I wouldnt call this a dissapointment.

Bottle thanks to Solan!  Thanks again.  The aroma is lots of sugars, honey, raspberry in the slightest amount, and phenol alcohol...lots of it!  This damn near burns my nose when smelling it!  However...even with that detractor this stuff is still effin unbelievable!!  I have had multiple samples of it over the past week and a half or so and I have come to the conclusion that I simply must always have a bottle of this on hand at all times.  It was a little overbearing at first, but now I cant get enough of this stuff.  The flavor is lots of residual sugars, sweet sweet honey elixir without being too syrupy or cloying.  There is also just a little hint of the alcohol but it is very welcoming in this sipper.  And at 16% alcohol...it really should be a sipper.  Overall fantastic stuff, and it has definitely set me up to embark on finding more meads!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2007 Wow. I wasnt sure heading in how much Id like this - all of the few meads Ive tried so far have been very unimpressive, with unpleasant acetone/solventy type flavors. This one: absolutely none of that. As good as I might have imagined this, this beats it. Beautiful big sweet honey aromas and flavors, with an earthy almost farmy background. Actually the farmy component reminds me of something very specific: the horse barns at the state fair, with aromas of horse sweat and urine soaked hay. But thats not to say this seems like brett or lambic. Not at all. Rounded clean palate. Easy finish. Hardly any hint of its potent alcoholic strength. I poured this into a dessert wine glass, and just couldnt help but treat myself to 3 or 4 more pours. I dont think this is going to be able to last long in my house! Surprisingly dark color, a tawny caramel type brown. Im not doing a great job making this sound great, but it was.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2009 This guy stands out as a behemoth in the mead category, Im psyched, so here goes.....Beautiful reddish honey color with a nice dark, reflective look and nice legs (hate using wine terms).  Aroma is big and very sweet - lots of fresh honey and a bit of alcohol.  Also picking up some earth and berries.  Flavor is a wonderful mix of honey, alcohol (just enough to burn!), berry/earth/mother naturs/back to my primal roots kind of thing.  Wonderful, thick mouthfeel.  Wow - super strong and I can only imagine it gets even better with serious aging (as do most meads).  Awesome!  Thanks to miketd and stateline liquors for bottles of this guy.

Pours a rich, viscous clear amber color.  Rousing leaves a thin sheet of mead slowing rolling down the glass sides.  Great aroma of honey, alcohol, and a spicy herbal background.  A sip coats the mouth with a honeyed sweetness that expands outward into a very earthy herbal character.  Dont give nearly as much heat as I thought it would.  The taste pleasantly lingers and tingles on the palate.  Damn good.

750ml bottle @ RBNAG07. Beautiful amber body, pours with an almost oily consistence. Harmonic aroma of honey, dry fruit and some alcohol. Flavor is much the same as aroma, honey, dry fruit and warming alcohol. Nice and well balanced.

What a nice mead.  There is more going on here than I have in my notes.   Pours clear bronze with very nice legs to it.  The aroma has sweet honey, heather, liquor-like and spices.  The body is very thick smooth and velvety and just glides through its entire journey.  The taste has honey, sugar, syrup, hint of berry and dark toffee.  The alcohol is quite apparent, but works as a positive instead of a negative ~ just the right amount showing through.  A terrific mead that I hope to enjoy again.

Bottle in a basket.  Looks like bourbon but with a golden hue.  Nose of honey with raspberry as it warms; a touch of alcohol.  Intensely sweet, as expected, but not really cloying.  Feels syrupy in the mouth at first but lightens out and becomes airy in a menthol kind of way.  Very much like a sherry, hints of wood.  Subtleties emerge with the long clinging aftertaste; for me the best part of this mead experience.

Clear amber colored headless body. Massive and inviting sweet aroma of alcohol-soaked fruits. Notes of herbs, mild spices, honey and burnt wood. Heavy, but refined sweetness in the flavor with honey and loads of various fruits. Syrupy mouthfeel. Fat body. Delicate sweetness and warming alcohol in the finish. A sweetheart! (Bottle @ RBNAG07)

All hail high residual sugars.  The star of the tasting of the night.  It makes you wonder why dont brewers mash more beers with temperatures resulting in high unfermentable  sugars.  Tasted at Patron Saints Angel Share Release.  Bottle from Ughsmash.  Tried with deftim13, brewboy1, Captaincougar, and others.  JohnC, miketd, and WeeHeavy were here earlier, but left by this time.  Not sure of the age.  Something about 25 yrs aging, and something, about winning awards in 1996 on the bottle. No signs of oxidation.  Im not sure if a mead is subject to oxidation in the same way as beer.  Very sweet. Vinous aroma, probably due to the high alcohol level.  Lots of honey, and I detect peach in the aroma.  No carbonation.  Amber yellow color.  Wonderful!  Would like more, but at $25/bottle wont buy for a while.
75 cl bottle. Amber color, no head. Sweet fruit, honey, leather, a bit smoke. Wow! (RBNAG07 in Grimstad Nov. 3th.)

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007 No head. Deep amber body. Intense sweet rounded alcoholic aroma of apple, raisins, and honey. Mild, velvety apple, raisins, and honey taste. Notes of vanilla, wood, and smoke. Silkily smooth mouthfeel. Prunes and dried fruit. Kind of like a good port. Some alcohol heat, but not much alcohol taste. Incredible. Far and away the best mead I’ve ever had. (0.75l bottle at RBNAG’07, purchased at a honey shop in Krakow. For best results, let it rest in the glass for 10-15 minutes to let the alcohol fumes drift away. If you do that you’ll start to wonder if this isn’t quite possibly the best drink there is, beer, mead, or otherwise.)

Courtesy of after4ever and shared with after4ever and bitbucket. Pours a rich deep amber. The aroma is huge with sweet honey, red wine tannins, some mild alcohol and hints of wood. The mead enters thick, chewy and sludgingly sludgy. The honey hits first then it is followed by a quick burst of red wine tannins then very sweet honey and a hint of wood. It ends with honey, sugar and faint alcohol. I also am starting to get mild dark fruity esters. This is a thick product leaving behind sweetness and honey behind far into the after taste.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2008 Poured from a 750 ml bottle.  Glowing amber appearance; a thin syrup.  Honey, pineapple, and burnt toffee aroma; fried ice cream slathered with a rich maple reduction.  Intensely and impossibly sweet, but within reason, still, somehow.  Flavor dances with a tangy, bright, hot rhythm; syrupy honey, coconut milk, almond frosting.  Forceful and soft, and far from one-dimensional; trills of watermelon and canteloupe ring out brightly and quickly over the top.  Toffee candy and pineapple sugar bring it back in the finish, concluding an extended, viscous, and sticky texture that penetrates every corner of the mouth.  Pushes heat out the nose; graham and tanned marshmallow linger indefinitely.  The exemplar of sugary overkill somehow rendered pleasant.  A regal, luxurious experience all around, even if its sweetness bears a little heavy for my taste.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2008 Wow.  The aroma on this is so cloyingly sweet and sherried port, kind of sharp.  Fantastic aroma.
Taste is sweet honey with a nectar-like quality.  Lingers very nicely, if developing a somewhat simple syrupy flavor.  
Very, very nice. My first example of a mead.  Wow.  Can you really beat this?

Bottle shared by foofaa.  Pours a medium orange/amber color with no head.  Aroma of honey, alcohol, some floral hints.  Syruppy sweet.  Flavor is a lot of honey, heavy on the booze.  Very tasty, but definitely a sipper!

750, corked and foiled. Pours syrupy dark burnished amber with golden highlights. Gargantuan big daddy tarantula legs up the sides of the snifter on the swirl--holy cow. Sharp boozy nose, especially at first. Then caramel, vanilla, honey, and floral notes creep in. Amazingly three dimensional aromatics profile, constructed seemingly entirely out of sugar. Thick, viscous, tongue-drowningly gloppy body. Delectable goo. Complex woody, floral, and arrayed sugar taste notes (see above from the nose). Lingering sticky sweet finish. This stuff is so good you want to stick your fingers in it and pick your nose.
rbesg06, bottled. clear amber, quite bright, flat. port-like aroma, a bit musty, vanilla and honeycomb. very sweet and sticky but in a good way, lacking any flaws, would go well on ice cream
Shared bottle courtesy of foofaa. Poured a medium orange color with no head. Aromas of honey, berries, and alcohol. Tastes of honey and berries. Sweet. One to drink slowly by the fireplace.

Thanks to foofaa for sharing this top rated mead.  Pours a lightly hazy orange amber with little to no head.  Aroma of honey, alcohol, cherries, dark fruits, vanilla, floral notes and scotch.  Flavor of honey, lots of sweetness, orange, other various fruits...this is a sweet sipper...but very enjoyable. Thanks for sharing Dan.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2009 Thanks to Santa for sending me this one. Upon pouring it is slow like oil creating a beautiful golden color. Aroma is heavy with alcohol and wood, berries and sweet honey. The flavor is sweet with a nice raspberry touch to it, light wood and a thick stciky mouthfeel. A Perfect nightcap.

Courtesy boboski. Poured a clear amber color. This just looked like syrup in the glass as it stuck to the edges. The aroma was profound of honey, flowers, and alcohol. The aroma was intense with sweetness. I knew the flavor was going to be big, but this was huge on flavor. Had huge honey flavors with some floral flavors in the background. The alcohol warmth was there, but not overpowering. The alcohol was masked really well. The mouthfeel was very full, slick and sticky to the palate. I have experienced nothing like it. This was just huge on flavor, that I could only take so much of it. This had quite a kick to it. I am definitely glad that I got the chance to try this. A truly world class mead. Thanks again Jason.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2008 [Consumed large amounts over time @ Sunset Grill, bottle aged 8-9 years, apparently] Extremely powerful aroma-- sweet and full of fruit; flowery. Complex. Clear dark amber appearance, like liquid brown sugar. Superior honey flavors, so dense and slick with an incredible complexity. Cherries, woody honey and some slight maple. Huge honey character, overall. Super smooth and easy to drink... kind of dangerous Really one of my favorites.

750ml bottle courtesy of boboski.  Nose like rich honey and roses, full and immensely heavy, the sweetness, flowers and alcohol almost palpable in the air.  Medium-dark clear amber color, no visible carbonation as this stuff pours nearly like syrup.  Flavor is my textbook definition of what a fermented honey beverage would be -- it really is like drinking thinned out honey, the alcohol is there but in the background for the most part as the immense honey character and floral touches dominate.  Mouthfeel is incredibly smooth and thick, syrupy and sticky, body is seemingly huge.  This stuff is pretty amazing, but even a few ounces was a bit much for me.

Pours a thick dark golded brown.  Aromas of port, oak, roses, figs, honey, and alcohol.  The flavors are a little smokey with hints of scotch, figs, honey, grapes, sweetness, and spicyness.   This is by far the tastiest mead I have ever had.

The aroma has some alcohol, but its mostly about a complex sweetness. The flavor has wild flowers with a complex honey and maple sweetness and alcohol. The body is light to medium with a very liquorous texture. This is verrrry sweet, but, very interesting if your sample isnt too big because I guess the sweetness could become sickening fast.

Glass sampled @ Sunset Grill with the Mad_Indian. Pours deep golden with no head. Aroma of alcohol, honey, syrup, and floral. The flavor is sweet, honey, syrup, with a nice kick of alcohol, that leaves you with a burn in your chest.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2007 Sampled with Stegosaurus during our second Boston Tour. Served at Sunset Grill. Orange pour with no carbonation/ no head. Huge honey aroma with hints of maple. Sweet taste with alcohol punch that warms your inside on the finish. Interesting and good.

My 1900th rating! Bottle (250ml) shared with HogTownHarry, biegaman & Viggo -- courtesy of biegaman. Despite its high rating I wasnt expecting much from this as Im not a huge fan of Mead -- turns out Ive just had poor to mediocre Meads all this time. Pours a dark shiny orange with no head at all, which is to be expected. Aroma: Holy cow, what an aroma! Wood, slightly burnt caramel, brown sugar, fruit, alcohol, honey and much more, theres so much going on in this complex aroma. Flavour: Holy fuck, Im pretty sure this is the best tasting beverage Ive ever had. WOW! Where to begin? Sweet taste of wood, honey, fruit, spices, alcohol, nuts and...gah, words cant describe how amazing it tastes...I dont want it to end. You can barely taste the 16% alcohol at all -- crazy! I am very sad that I cant go out and buy bottles of this, I truly hope to enjoy it again one day. Simply superb.

(Bottle, Akkurat, Stockholm 14 Sep 2007) Mahogany colour with no head. Fruity, sweet nose with syrup, dog-rose flowers and herbs. Full, sweet taste with herbs, rose-hip, raspberries and honey. Very full body, thick and oily texture. Lots of alcohol shining through, not very surprisingly. Very complex and absolutely lovely.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2007 My home bar contains a myriad of decadent alcohol. There are many beverages I always have on hand, but the list of favorites is small: Laphroaig 15 year old Islay Scotch, Imperia Vodka, Cazadores Reposado Tequila, Orval Trappist Ale, any number of Grand Marque Cognacs, varying first-growth Bordeaux, assorted lambics...and this nectar of such divinity...it is nearly indescribable. Any random sip is as rewarding as the first; surely the current bottle will never be the last. 
The pour is the antithesis of tumultuous and astonishing in its vivid display of dense colors, bright and concentrated purity in a form so pristine a photograph would never do it justice. Translucent dark amber, apparent impenatrable molecular composition revealing swirling hues of ruby, sunburst orange, merengue yellow and liquidified bronze, shrouded in an oily cocoon. Thick legs seem wildly strewn about. Never has a still pour revealed such character and essence of life.
Scents of barrels that previously housed cognac and sherry spring to life as the glass is drawn to the nose. The richest and most expensive honeys, intricate in detailed spice and variations, follow soon after. Elegant sherry glides forward, blanketed behind fiercely sweet aged honey. The honey seems incredibly old and holds dominion over all else in the glass. The rose and raspberry puree create a distinct, underlying, complex backnote but are unidentifiable as separate additions. Also noted are light smoke, tangerine peel, powdered molasses, figs and indeterminate dried fruits. What remarkable variation and glorious eloquence stems from such a simple yet painstakingly crafted fermentation and aging. A gentle touch is at hand, despite copious infiltration of honey in gargantuan proportions to water and yeast.
A sweetness unlike any other is paramount in the flavor, but this beverage only seems cloying if sipped too quickly. This is certainly a mead for sharing, for long contemplative sips, a bottle to enjoy over a week, month or perhaps longer. Sweet, venomous nectar at the forefront of each sip - the only viable antidote is the refreshment and intoxicating mosaic of the initial moment this touches the tip of the tongue for a second time. Acidity is low in feeling, though in reality it must be enormous to be even this noticeable and cut through and scatter a minor portion of sticky honeyed sweetness. Alcohol is warming instantly, much like the Cognac that falsely masquerades through the nose. The finish is sweet and smooth, very warming and comforting, lightly fruity with lingering peppery spice and earthy cooling. The contrast of warmth and chills in the finale is exhuberating.
The mouthfeel is as full bodied as maple syrup, possibly moreso, certainly much more density than is found in a typical(or an atypical) mead or similar. Viscous doesnt do the slick feeling justice. Biting tannins are only dulled at the edges due to the honey bath theyre awash in. This is so phenomenal. I truly wish I could let everyone I know sample this staggering achievement, and I shall do my best. Simply breathtaking. This mead redefined decadence when I first sampled it years ago and continues to shape my opinions on the subject today.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2007 Thanks to Rooftoprogue for sharing this gem. I will preface this rating with the admission that I dont drink a lot of mead. The pours a nice deep clear amber with solid legs. Wonderful and addictive aroma of dark honey, flowers, and caramel. Mouthfeel is full and syrupy without being sticky. Flavor of rich dark honey, cherry, and maple syrup with lots of sweetness. However this falls short of being cloying, and the alcohol is almost undetectable. At 16%, this is very dangerous. What an amazing beverage. This goes on my wants list.

The finale of Indras Mead, Cider and Sake Tasting on 8/31/07. We definitely saved the best for last; big thanks go out to boboski for sending this one up to us. Pours a clear deep orange/brown with nice legs. The aroma is of sweet, nutty honey; "warm" and enviting. Medium to full-bodied and super-smooth it finishes long and sweet (unlike the last two meads we had sampled). Candy-sweet without being cloying, warm and nutty, my words cannot do this beverage justice. If youve never tried this mead, do so. I cannot fathom anyone disliking it; its an amazing sensory experience.

Bottle (250ml).  Shared with blankboy, biegaman and viggo - bottle courtesy of biegaman.  Rating #2500 - woo!  Clear amber pour - looks good!  Aroma - of my cock, thats amazing!  initially boozy, then settles down quickly - ripe dates, ferraro roche chocolate, Ill stop describing and taste now.  Taste.  Wow.  I have no words.  Lovely legs, smooth, not too strong, I could drink a bucket of this.  Smooth, slick, moderate alcohol, nutty, fruity - how could you not love this?  Its almost gone now - I shall mourn its passing ...

Bottle, at RBESG 2007 in Glasgow, Grand Tasting. Beautiful deep amber to mahogany colour, no head nor carbonation. Intense oaky and honey aroma. Intense oaky and honey sweet flavour, very impressive but too sweet for me.  (No wonder it is sweet, with the insane amount of honey it is made with.)

Sept. 2005 - Okay...this is my first mead. I think Ill stick to BEER. It tastes like honey...only sweeter (goodness, is that possible?). Maybe if I had some more meads, Id be able to say whether this is average, above average, or below.

This is one of the best drinks ever to cross my tongue.  Thanks to boboski for making this available for our little tasting.
Pours amber brown with some crazy legs.  Aroma of berries and butter rum chewy candy.  The butter rum character appears in the flavor as well.  Very creamy palate.  Incredible.
Bottled. Pours a deep amber colour. Sweet aroma of honey and some spices. The flavour is sweet with honey, spices and slight fruitish.

Second Mead of the night at the Indra - Cider, Sake and Mead tasting 8/31/07.  Pour is orange amber, completely still.  Aroma is butterscotch rum.  Some floral honey in the nose as well.  Taste is initially more of the butter scotch, though it eases nicely into the honey and has a nice long finish.  The body is syrupy and sweet, without being cloying.  I had never had anything that remotely tasted like this, and loved it.  This was excellent, the one I went back to for sipping until the cab came to get me.  I would enjoy this like a fine port.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2012 Bottled at RBESG 07.  Dark brown. Aroma of honey and brown sugar. Sweet and very mature, fruity and balsamic. Honey wrapped in cotton, so soft. Something special indeed!
Bottle, RBESG Grand Tasting 07. Coppery red, no head. Strong alcoholic tones, with honey sweetness. Hints of cowshit in the nose with some straw. Mouth is sweet coating, honey fruitiness. Great

A Mes rate: 
Bottle at RBESG. Lovely dark red amber colour. Toffee and alcohol nose. Incredibly sweet flavour with bags of fruit and honey. Just a little too sweet for me. Not at all cloying however. Lovely mouthfeel. A fantastic mead.

thanks cmubeerman. watered down coke appearance. strongly ethanol aroma. extreemely sweet and smooth. so creamy.  so much so. better tasting than smelling.  cant remember if it is better than the sweet blossom one.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Rated. (Aug 2007) Apis Póltorak Jadwiga , Apis Dwójniak Staropolski  and Gales Mead Wine alongside each other at home. Many thanks to RickGordon for letting me take the Apis ones home from RBESG07... Deep brown Red ... Rich sherry honey tomes and a little woody in nose ... Very rich ... very complex ... Sweet cherry and honey ...  little maple syrup ... little raisin little wood ... definitly the most complex though i strugle to pin down flavours... Its such a pity i dont have Moniac mead in the house to compair that as well as ive rated it 4.5  and i suspect this has the edge.

Bottle at home ... Thanks Ben .. March 2017 ... woody fruits .. rich sweet honey .. heavy fruit nose .. very sweet .. wooody mead.. rich thick viscous .. very fruity .. heavy fruits .. quite datey ... .. rich sweet fruits
A pretty terrible, noxious, alcoholic aroma.  my friend mike likes it but only kind of.  hollaaa.  taste is a lot like medicine.  smells like the inside of an old suitcase.

Bottle, (from State Line Liquors, Elkton, MD) Pours clear reddish amber with no head (about as exciting as a mead can look). Sweet honey and alcohol aroma, as expected, but a little more floral than other meads that Ive sampled. Strong, very sweet honey flavor, with berries, brown sugar, vanilla, and maple syrup notes. Alcohol makes its presence felt in the finish, but not to the extent I expected. Thick, syrupy mouthfeel. really great mead.

Berries on the nose, honey of course, grapes, sweet smelling overall.  Pours amber with a red hue.  Smooth and sweet, caramel, alcohol, very floral, with a nice fruitiness.  Very nice mouth feel, coats your mouth.

Courtesy boboski.  My first mead experience!  Thick, syrupy, golden amber body that shows ample legs as you roll it around the glass.  Looks like a thick muscat or icewine.  Beautiful blend of honey, cognac, and flowers on the nose.  Alcohol is quite apparent, though not unpleasant, in the aroma.  The flavor is very sweet, with honey and a wide spectrum of floral tastes melding perfectly together.  The sweetness hides the alcohol quite well, though not completely.  Thick, syrupy mouthfeel, which is expected.  The body is very slick on the tongue, and quite pleasant. Sweet, smooth finish.  Excellent as a desert drink.  Im sold on mead!

(big thanks to irishboy for the sample)deep orange with no head.aroma is honey,alcohol,and slight rose.flavor is honeyy,rose,raspberries,brown sugar,and cane sugar.nice mouthfeel with a thick and complex palate.i can see why this is the best rated mead.

Hand bottle sample via trade with IrishBoy - My first mead.  So I will rate it like a beer since I dont know any better.  Pours a reddish mohagany color with no head or carbonation.  Aroma is very vinous.  Flavor is estery sweet and the honey is noticeable but not too strong.  Its really nice.  Thick body.  This was a pleasant suprise.  Thanks Richard.

Beyond mead, this is the thickest, fullest richest mead there is out there. aroma is floral with a hint of fruit. Its a real thick mead, dark color mead that will linger with for a while. Taste is honey, Alcohol, wood and dark fruit. Not for the casual drink. Proceed with caution
UPDATED: NOV 8, 2007 The aroma is very sweet with honey, raspberries, and alcohol. The appearance is mahogany. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is thick. Overall its great.
Thanks to my  Dad for this sample.  Medium amber hue. Aroma is honey, alcohol, cane sugar.  Taste is very sweet, like honeycomb, butterscotch, almost like a schnapps.  Pretty neat to try this.

Bottle a bonus from mgumby10! Nose of sweetness, honey, and fermentation; crystal clear orange amber with no hint of a head; flavor is very sweet of honey and a mild alcohol note. Extremely rich, like a thick syrupy botrytis wine. I can see why this is the #1 mead!

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2007 Courtesy of Styles
Bottle:  Aroma of honey and tequilla with enough alcohol to tingle the nose.  It pours a transparent orange with no head.  This literally has legs after swirling it around the glass.  I imagine for a mead, appearance does not get any better.  The flavor has honey, apple, and a hint of maple syrup.  There is a faint alcohol burn in the finish, but only the slightest flavor.  Its sweeter and not as vinous as other meads Ive had.  It has a sticky and coating mouthfeel.  If not for the tequila presence, this could be my highest rated "beer" on the site.

Thick oily deep red brown body; Alcohol sharp, lots of dusty spicy aromas, green nuts, only very, very little fruit/flowers; Super oily syrup like texture, super sweet, very pleasant but incredibly 1-dimensional and SUPER boring, the only thing interesting here is the slight alcohol burn; Super long overly sweet very 1-dimensional finish, a very little flower, but overpowered by green nuts. Who is fooling me here???? The highest rated Mead. What the fuck. I guess this is the most boring drink I have ever had that I wouldnt define as bad. I would drink a sweet Sherry or Madeira, or any other sweet wine over this any day, in fact I would rather drink water then this MEAD!

Had this at ct7 shared but puddintane i think. Aroma was really sweet and honey and maybe light spicing. Really smooth and easy to drink for for being so high in alcohol. This would be a good one to leave around for awhile and sip on.

My first mead ever and probably the best Ill ever drink. The aroma is a welcoming precursor to the taste. Incredible Lotus-honey scent that leads to intense sweet-honey thats a Doppleganger around an encompassing mouthfeel. The sweetness is so intense--like drinking 5 blends of Port--my mouth can only handle small sips. It cloys the throat on the way down while congealed heat warms the esophagus. Truly fascinating to drink. I feel like a Knight of the Round Table while consuming.

Porto and very floral clover honey aroma that is not overly strong.  Viscuous liquid amber appearance.  Sweet, thick, floral clover honey with some herbs and spices--it is very difficult to single out any one contributor.  A tiny bit medicinal and a little sherry-like with a touch of alcohol flavour.  Big body and sticky sweet.  I love honey and therefore I love this drink.

The emperor has no cloths.  I dont exactly know why, but this tasted like some nasty cough syrup, somewhat reminding me of some decent desert wines that I have enjoyed, but while reminicient of good tasting drink, this itself was NASTY, again, cough syrup with honey and port poured in, but not in a good day.  Stay away!  It was a gift.  I am afraid that I may never sample MEAD again...oh well, back to the beer!

My first mead, and quite an opening act! Hailed as one of the finest examples I was both excited and intimidated. My expectations were high, yet what exactly I expected, I did not know. Its orangy rose hue appeared bright and clear hinting at its mellifluous nature. No head was present but prominent legs lined the glass in an almost mathematical arrangement. Upon the nose, alcohol strikes with great vigor, the waxy properties of honey are present, but almost sugar free. Efflorescent aromas of lilac, honeysuckle and lily of the valley add to the subtle complexity, further accreting with cream, maple and a white wine tonality. The abundance of sugar only becomes apparent on the palate and lends texture to the heavy alcohol notes. The viscous liquid is far more satisfying to the taste as it dissolves on the tongue in an almost crystalline fashion. Honeysuckle is omnipresent, as if the nectar of a hundred flowers was dripped into my glass. The complex amalgam of light honey flavors reminds of blueberry blossom, clover and acacia varieties, an ultimately soothing sensation, and a reminder of how remarkable nature really is. With time, delicate accents are revealed, peach and apricot, hints of orange and Charentais melon, add to the fruity sensation. Almond extract, clove and licorice are also noticeable with effort. The smooth and uncarbonated syrup seeps deep into the veins, warming on its way to the tips of your fingers. Though I dont doubt the eminence of this mead, I can hardly see an appropriate time to drink it, and even on that rare occasion I find that a good tawny port would provide greater fulfillment.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2007 The aroma is dominated by pruns, figs and you can sense the alcohol too. The flavor is full of honey, but also the raisens and at the top you can taste the alcohol, but only for a brief moment, then it gets sweet and the aftertaste is also sweet from the honey. 

What an amazing mead!

1200 raar. Reddish amber, no head, lacing is legs like wine. Aroma is huge honey with caramel and fruit notes, hint of oak. Very full bodied mead. Syrupy, sticky extremely sweet finish. Some alcohol is there but its very minor. It was tough to drink most of the bottle on my own though.. damn.

Light sweet honey aroma.  Reddish-golden brown body.  Full and very thick palate.  The flavor here is monster-thick honey.  It is sticky, but not hard to drink actually.  Alcohol is noticeable but not overdone.  A fine, dry honey flavor for certain with very light floral aspects.

Shared by puddintane at the Columbus tasting #7-Thanks Dave.Honey,straw and lots of alcohol dominates the aroma.Pours very deep copper with no head.Very thick honey flavor with lots of alcohol as well.Very full mouthfeel with very sweet alcohol finish.

Bottle shared at columbus 7 by puddintane - Pours dark amber with no head. Aromas of honey, raisin, and other dark fruits, maybe a touch of brown sugar and some alcohol.  Flavor is full of honey, some brown sugar, and a touch of spice.  I also picked up some vanilla in here.  Amazingly sticky sweet on the palate.  Smooth with low carbonation.  The 16% alcohol is very well covered.  This is quite interesting stuff and pretty easy to drink for something so big..

C-Bus 7 Bottle shared by puddintane: Pours a clear coppery honey color, no head. Aroma, honey, some fruits, sugary, some spicy notes. Flavor, honey, spice, vanilla, very sweet and rich. Medium to full bodied, really outstanding.

Bottle shared by: Tronraner, and NachlamSie.  Pours a deep honey brown color with no head.  Aroma is amazing honey, vanilla, slightly woody, and some alcohol.  Flavor is sweet honey, with some vanilla, wood, and a slight alcohol burn.

Bottle shared with Tronraner, SHP555, and TheBeerCellar2 during my Dark Lord excursion. Pours a dark, clean, clear brown. Surprisingly see-through for this style and color. The nose has excellent honey definition: clean, sweet, not-cloying, and not overly vinous but with a good backdrop of floral, estery, and fruity scents.  The flavor has a delightful, full honey flavor with rose hips, honey comb, and suggestions of red wine. I was afraid this would be either too sweet or too vinous, however it achieves the perfect balance.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2010 Sample from 50 cL bottle. Pours deep orange. Aroma is honey, spicy, no real alcohol feel. Alcohol comes up once a sip is taken, it has a strong alcohol odour which goes into the eyes. Flavour is sweet honey, raisins with a strong spice note, goes into a apple sourness and ends sugary sweet.

Bottle shared with NachlamSie, shp555, and TheBeerCellar2. Pours a nice copper color with intense legs. The aroma is very floral honey, the subtle pollen notes than I love in a good mead, some raisin, and profound general honey. The flavor is serious honey with lots of floral tones, white raisins, lemon zest, and quite a bit of sugar. It leaves a sweet fruity finish with some alcohol warmth. The alcohol is very smooth for something this high. Its also amazing that something so huge and flavorful is able to preserve the subtleties of the honey, which is my primary criterion for a good mead. The balance in this is just unbelievable. A great, great mead here.

Wooowwwwww! Had a glass of this at a bar and I was absolutely blown away. Such a dark pour for a mead, unbelievably thick and viscous, no doubt being the closest cousin of buckwheat honey. Lush, rich, and huge in the mouth, this mead is truly something to behold. I guess its right there amongst beers like dark lord and speedway stout on this site, in that it is undoubtedly just an absolutely enormous creation, but really this stuff is plain fantastic. Here were my notes:

aroma: licorice, buckwheat honey, diapers, dandelion, raspberry, rose.
flavor: alarmingly thick, cinnamon, anise, buckwheat honey, booze

Ive had this several times but decided to rate it tonight.  Beautiful translucent amber color with no carbonation or head. This stuff has some awesome legs.  aroma is honey, pollen, toffee, madeira, and some earthy funk.  Flavor is definitely oxidized madeira, sweet, honey.  Fantastic mouthfeel that coats your entire mouth cavity.  This stuff is really, really nice.  As a Polish person, Ive had this many times!

Thx to the ever so generous sk8viking. Pours a clear brown. Smells like a mild port. Sweet and portish, well balanced. Alcohol notes in the beginning. Quite fruity - plums and berries. Very portish with out the alcohol dryness. Excellent!

750ml bottle, label reads aged 6 years, 16%abv. pours a clear beautiful reddish-mahogony color. nose is really nice too, port quality to it, honey, raspberries, and alcohol. flavor is awfully sweet, honey, some smoke, strawberries, lots of alcohol, but this rather cloying. sorta cough syrup consistency. reminds me of port wine. this is nice but the alcohol and cloying sweetness is a bit too overwhelming. this has nothing on sweet desire!

Pours a sticky-looking golden color... the color of honey (go figure.)  Smells incredibly sweet (like honey) with a bit of alcohol... almost like a whiskey.  The alcohol is definitely present, but not overwhelming.  Tastes great... thick and smooth.  Ive heard something about drinking this warm with a cinnamon stick in it, which kind of gives you an idea of what it might taste like.  Something to drink on a cold snowy day.

basket bottle...25 year old aged version...appearance: poured a deep amber-brown with a medium, thick body... aroma: sweet honey with dark fruits.  not as strong of a bourbon aroma as the Sweet Desire.  in fact, it was very much less evident here..... taste: very sweet, more so than the Desire but very drinkable.  has a nice port-like quality to it.  liquid has a full body and coats the mouth.  you can sense the alcohol but it isnt overwhelming

Basket bottle.  My first mead.  I have tried this a couple times under different temperatures to get an overall impression.  Pours a whisky color with tremendously thick legs.  Aroma is sweet, meaty, alcoholic, and a whole bunch of honey.  Smells strong, like a liquor.  Taste is sweet, delicious honey.  Incredibly thick in the mouth, feels like drinking pure honey.  Alcohol hidden very well, though you can feel the warmth but it is not present in the taste.  This rocks.  It really isnt comparable to beer so I do not know how to rate it accordingly but whatever.  Its still one of the better things Ive tasted.

Bottle.  [Respect to Sk8viking for sharing this one]  This is my first experience with Mead or Mjød, as it original was called in Denmark. No apparent head was visible. Body was clear with a ruby red hue. What hits the nose was quite unexpected with notes of heavy malt. Honey, fruity, toasted, nutty, port wine or fortified wine/dessert wine. Lost of dark fruity notes as raisin, prunes and hints of spices. Full bodied with a sticky and slightly alcoholic texture and a totally flat carbonation. (Are there suppose to be any in Mead?). Flavor is heavy sweet and light alcoholic, not much bitter or burned notes to counter the sweetness. Finish is sweet and average lasting. Incredible encounter, thanks again René!

Basket Bottle via Boboski (thanks!). Pours a crystal clear amber. Nose is honey, port and alcohol. Wow, how to describe the taste...This is so complex i am bewildered. First off, there is some of the most divine raw honey i have ever tasted. And it finishes with a refined honey. And in between there is some vanilla, some sherry, some grapes, some strawberries, some vanilla...but all sooo subtle so as to not get in the way of the incredible honey. Alcohol is well hidden for 16% but is warming in the finish. This is pure bliss in abottle. Wonderful stuff.

Sampled this @ Aofoxxys Labor Day gathering 06.  Cant remember if I have theDm, or Jsquire to thank for this one of two mead samples, but kudos to the responsible party just the same.  Floral nose of much caramel & maple syrup, some alcohol, almost portish.  Pours a slightly reddish copper, mostly amber with no head.  The hugely sweet flavor is overpowering; in my notes I wrote "obscene like maple syrup, holy shit".  The full body is cloying and flat.

Bottle. Thanks to Sk8viking. Dark red color with a white none head. Aroma is heavy honey, fruit, berries, raisins, spices and alcohol (like a sherry or port). Taste is heavy sweet with a long duration. Body is full, texture is syrupy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. Lovely nice and complex.

Had this at The Hop Leaf.  Pours clear brown (dark honey) with no head; it is rather syrupy in viscosity.  Aroma is average malt (toffee), light hops (flowers), light yeast (dough) with notes of port and honey.  Full bodied, oily texture, flat carbonation and a smooth, alcohol finish.  Average duration, heavy sweetness, moderate acidity and light bitterness.

My first mead experience. Deep amber color, clear. Complex aroma very similar to port, with butterscotch, flowers, berries. The taste is primarily honey, extremely sweet with hint of metallic in the finish. Even before I read the description I picked out the rose flavor. Alcohol is almost imperceptible. I think by its nature it would be difficult to drink more than a few ounces at a time, and it produced massive cravings for water. With that, and having tried no other meads to date, I would say that its hard to imagine much better than this from a mead. (Bottle purchased at Julios).

I finally got to try this, which many aficionados claim to be the end-all-be-all of Mead.  I saw it a few times in some liquor stores in the US, but was a little pricey for a style where Ive been burned so many times.  Big thanks to MDS for bringing this to the YEHa! party
Clear, stunning shade of bronze and totally oily, the legs on this is absolutely amazing.

Aroma is, in a word, intense.  Starts out woody, you can tell this stuff spent its fair share of time in the barrel.  Then this strange, catty, prunish overtone takes over, only to fade away eventually and then the honey takes over.  Dark, dark, almost burnt honeycombs, but really fresh, surprising since apparently this stuff is aged a long time.  You can almost feel the pollen and histamines tickle your nose.

Its thicker than double cream as you swallow it down, the sweetness is massive, and comes at you on varying levels, from soft, maple sugar to a more harsh rock candy sort of sweetness, with notes of cotton candy and mellow fruityness.  All this, and it hits you like those shots of honey and gin my grandma used to give us when we had sore throats.  Endless aftertaste, where the alcohol lingers and warms you slightly.  

It definately comes in as one of the sweetest meads Ive ever sampled, but it definately is cloying.  But there is a certain balance, in a warped kind of way, like a Triple IPA can be "balanced", I suppose it depends on your description of the term.  Even though I enjoyed Jadwiga I wouldnt drink a ton of this stuff, although Id take this over a port and about 80% of all dessert wines in a heartbeat, and it is worthy of the hype.

Sample at Barley Island tasting Jan 20, 2007 - Aroma is honey and clove with a berry undertone.  Pours transparent yellow with no head or lacing.  Flavor matches aroma with an alcohol bite.  Palate is sweet and syrupy.  I dont know, but meads are just not my style and I dont  get anything special from this one over the others I have tried.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2008 Bottle found (and it was quite a shock) at Discount Tobacco Beverage & More in Chesterland Ohio. Luminous dark reddish golden color.  Sweet but not overpowering aromas of honey, nectar, and rose petals with a slight alcohol nose.  The flavor is an experience that I will not forget: rose, nectar, and honey.  Sweetness persists through the finish but is still refreshing with pleasant alcohol warmth.  This is like the cognac or vintage port of beers.  I highly recommend this to everyone, and yes it is worth its relatively high price.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2011 Bottle thanks to Sk8viking. Deep red - no head. Raisins, dried fruits, berries, honey - lots of honey, sweet, bread, light licorice. A thick liquid - sticks to the tongue for a long time after - smooth !! This it lovely.

Bottle. Dark red colour with a small white head good looking Mjød. The aroma is intense, smack in your face, heavy honey, fruit, berries, spices and alcohol. The taste is a thick mouthfull of honey, fruity, berries, spices and a nise alcohol burn. Full body with a sweet alcoholic finish. Great Mjød !!!

Bottle. Still, tawny coloured body. Interesting aroma - butterscotch, caramel, and molasses with varying levels of intensity. Very thick and rich - creamy, almost buttery palate and very thick in texture. Lots of butterscotch and caramel flavour with honey stickiness up front. It actually finishes reasonably cleanly too with minimal alcohol burn considering its strength. Really good but you really have to be in the mood for this stuff and I know I certainly wouldnt be able to drink more than a couple of ounces of it at any given moment.

This is amazing.  Incredibly powerful aroma of honey, fruit and flowers with just a hint of lambic-like barnyardiness.  The flavor is very sweet and the texture is very rich, yet it somehow remains light on the tongue.  Highly recommended.

Didnt take much notes on this one.  Overyly sweet alcoholised drink with lots of honey and a little fruity flavour.  Some kind of honeyed Grand Marnier with a melted baklava or something.  Way too sweet for me.  Given all the praises it receives I hope to have another opportunity to try it and hopefully this next time before I lose speech capabilities.  But as it stands right now I was almost jaded-wiga by it.
Bu au YeHa! 06. Rousse comme de Rhûm brun. Arome intense de miel sucré et dalcool agréable. Goût super sucré mais très buvable, miel et alcool.
Pink golden body with great legs.  Very sweet alcoholic scent.  Viscous palate and thick, rich honey flavour.   Very honey at the end.

Pours a beautiful honey brown. Has aromas of cognac, honey, and nuts. While the aroma makes this seem like the alcohol is going to hit you in the face, this actually doesnt taste of alcohol or burn. This has a sweet, spicey, honey taste. Excellent.

Sampled at Low Countries RBM 2005.Hazy orange golden, no head of course. Great fullness in the aroma, sharp and warming of honey, rosehip and flower. Sweet honey and berry flavor. Soft and smooth like a mofo with a nice candied surupy touch. Extremely complex despite the sweetness, man this is good shit! Of all the liquids I tasted during this Ratebeer gathering this one stood out as the best!! I fell very lucky to have a whole bottle more of this :-)
Bottle. Is it a port wine? Red brown with no head. Little too sweet maybe but it would be nice as a dessert. Some raisin. Quite heavy.

Bottle.  Richly dark amber brown color.  Beautiful port like aroma, cherry, raisins, and apricot aromas.  Wonderfully sweet and warming with an oily palate.  Thanks to Nuffield for this sample.  Rating from 2004 notes.
Bottle at RBESG 2006. Mmmmmmmm... soooo smooth and delicious. Fruity and sweet, but not sickly. Just right.
Bottle at RBESG-06,GTN. Red/golden brown with no head. Aroma is honey, alcohol, fruit. Flavour is sweet, honey, sugar, alcohol, fruit.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2008 Bottle, 75cl (RBNAG 07) Had it again, when I had the opportunity, to make sure it was as delicious as I found it to be at the first sample, and it sure was. A nice, dark golden to amber pour, without any bubbles on top, a lovely, sweet, honey aroma with heather and some alcohol, and a full-bodied palate with honey, heather and sugary sweetness. Just delicious. The alcohol is well hidden. I rated it a bit higher this time, at 8-4-8-4-17-4.1 but I didnt change it due to the small difference. Bottled at RBESG-06, GTN. (Thx Rick) It pours with a cognac-look, dark amber with no head at all. Honey, alcohol and  notes of fruit, flowers and barnyard in the aroma. Full-bodied, with flavors of alcohol, sugar and honey in a heavenly blend. Sweet finish. Way better than the meads available in Norway. At 16% ABV, the alcohol is very well masked. (060826)

Thanks a million to my secret santa for this one! pours out a thick syrupy ruby/brown color with no head. Aroma is decieving with some notes of fruit and honey but does not give away the intensity of the sweetness of the mead. .  Taste is very sweet honey, raspberry, and some wood on the finish. Very sweet. For the first of this style Id have to say thumbs up!!!

Orange colour, oily lacing. Aroma from paint, alcohol and honey. Sugar, sugar and loads of sugar......Alcoholic and unpleasant. I just don´t like mead i guess.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2007 1000th rating. 27+ year old bottle.  I received this bottle in a trade over 2 years ago and it was 25 years old when I traded for it. 
The pour is darker than I expected.  There is no carbonation, no head. Extensive legs on the glass.  The pour is dark reddish brown but clear. The aroma is sweet and but mostly alcoholic.  This is a sipping drink to be sure.  The flavor is sweet and full of spice. Caramel, candy, flowers, honey.  Quite delicious.  The body is viscous, smooth, silky and well blended.  The alcohol is there, but well blended with everything else.  There is almost a flavor of cream and fruit.
Bottled (Apis Miod Poltorak Jadwiga). Amber colour, no head. Aroma wineous, caramelly and fruity. Very sweet. Flavour is honey, fruits and alcohol. Very sweet finish. Lovely honeyish aftertaste.

(Bottle) Beautiful warm, reddish amber with no head whatsoever. Sweet, alcoholic nose of caramel and alcohol. Extremely full-bodied and extremely complex flavour pattern with loads of honey and fruit acents. But this is EXTREMELY sweet - actually I dont believe Ive ever had anything this sweet in my life. I love its complexity but am having trouble with its sugary sweetness. 260806
